story:
Tickets for AJAX in IRAQ

are on sale now at www.NotManApart.com

 


AJAX in IRAQ Los Angeles Premiere - The Company, The Play, The Idea.         

 The LOS ANGELES PREMIERE of AJAX IN IRAQ will be the 2014 Season Opener for Not Man Apart. AJAX IN IRAQ is an important, timely and powerful piece of theatre written by Award-Winning Playwright Ellen Mclaughlin. 

At the forefront, the play tells the story of the many female combatants in the U.S. Armed Services that are subjected to intense physical sexual abuse, but remain quiet, intertwined with the parable story of the great warrior Ajax, which is said to be one of the first and oldest stories to openly portray the effects of post-traumatic stress disorder.

•               Stories like this can only be told through the generosity of Arts minded individuals such as yourself. We have no Endowment, nor Grants to tell this tale. Since the beginning of Theatre itself, the Performing Arts have relied on generous support from those who deeply care that important stories and experiences of our world be told. Those who understand the vital connection that entertainment has with enlightenment. This is a subject matter best brought to our attention in a visual, visceral, immediate way that highlights the new and ancient parts of our daily struggles and social injustices. The magnitude and gratification of having this piece of art come to life at this time, with this theatre company, in this city will be felt by all those that give a little part of themselves to have this become a reality. 

Not Man Apart - Physical Theatre Ensemble is a collective of multi-disciplined performing artists whose Mission Statement is TO GENERATE INNOVATIVE PHYSICAL WORKS OF THEATRE, CONTRIBUTING EDUCATIONAL AND TRANSFORMATIONAL EXPERIENCES. Est. 2007

•                The Company's Vision Statement is - 

TO BRING the Worlds of Dance and Theatre closer together, while honoring the power of the spoken word.  

TO REEXAMINE the Classics of Literature and our everyday World through a Visceral interpretation.  

TO CREATE Highly Athletic and Innovative Theatrical Events, which are Life-Affirming and consciousness expanding.

TO ELEVATE the Theatrical Experience to rival the excitement of Live Sports Events, and the Elegance and Intimacy of Dance.

 

 TO ESTABLISH a new kind of Physical Theatre Genre that is Inclusive, Relevant, Accessible, Exciting and Ineffable. 

•               

 

Our Goal & Where Your Contribution Goes - 

•               It can be a very expensive gesture these days to produce a play. Even if all the performers, choreographers and director donate their work for no pay, as is the case here, it still takes a great deal of money to produce and promote a piece of work. We need a minimum of $12,500 to produce this play - with quite nearly a volunteer core of artists. We then hope to raise whatever deficit we incur through ticket sales. 

We do this because we think these stories are important to tell, because we are passionate about making them in this medium, and finally because the shared experience with the audience is profound and potent. 

•                We have a great deal to share with you and many great perks that will make the shared experience of this project felt deeply by all those that give a piece of themselves to it. 

•                If we are able to raise our entire goal we will be able to pay for the space, the posters, the programs, the costumes, the props, the advertising, the promotion, the technical crew, the many designers, the set, and the royalties to do this play.

 

Other Ways You Can Help -

•                If there is something specifically you would like to contribute, time, energy, costumes, props or you want to fund something very specific, like advertising, costumes or designer compensation - for a credit in our program - we would love to speak with you directly. Please reach out to Artistic Director John Farmanesh-Bocca at NotManApart@Gmail.com

•                Please share this campaign! Please make some noise about what we are doing here! Once the campaign for fundraising is done come to the show you helped create and bring friends and family, multiple times, post on facebook, twitter and email folks.

story:
The Allure Dance DC Story

Allure Dance DC was started in January of 2013 by dancer, Abigail Dymond, with one dance class. That one class quickly grew to five classes a week, almost 50 dancers, and now three productions later...we are on the cusp of something great: a dance performance company working towards a breakout performance at our new, bigger venue!

Our Artistic Goal 

Now serving as our Artistic Director, Abby's goal is to provide dance education and instruction in a wide variety of disciplines, a creative outlet for choreographers, and performance opportunities for adult dancers in the Washington, D.C. area. 

Through her dedicated outreach, Abby is on the verge of creating a dynamic performance company comprised of local dancers with diverse backgrounds and expertise.  We aim to celebrate dance by making it accessible to the community through public performances, community events, and collaborations with other artists.

Who We Are

Abby brings 30 years of dance experience to Allure Dance DC. Training in classical ballet, pointe, modern, jazz & tap at the Metropolitan Ballet Theater and prestigious University of Arizona school of Dance, her credits include 7-time NFL Cheerleader, captain, choreographer and 2012 NFL Pro Bowl Cheerleader. She performed four years with a professional dance company in Washington, D.C., gracing the stage of the Lincoln Theater. She's danced professionally in Hong Kong, India & Europe and travelled on 12 Military Appreciation Tours all over the world, including four times to combat zones in Afghanistan & Iraq. 


Read more about our instructors here: Allure Dance DC Instructor Bios

Allure started as an emerging dance studio and the performance company is comprised of dancers of all levels – from beginners to exceptionally talented advanced dancers. What brings us all together is our shared love of dance. Many of our performance company members, and instructors, are former ballet studio kids, competition dancers, college dance team members, NFL cheerleaders, NHL & NBA dancers, and dance teachers looking for other avenues to continue dancing and performing. 

Our Growth

We produced three performances in 2013; each time growing in number of performers, number of performance pieces, styles of dance, audience attendees, and overall artistic quality. 

Read more about our dance styles here: Allure Dance Class Descriptions

We have outgrown our small black-box theater and are excited for the next step in our growth: our new, larger venue, a 350-seat professional proscenium theater. Our next performance is on June 28th & 29th at the Synetic Theater in Crystal City, VA. 

Since its start, Allure's cast has grown from 23, to 35, to 48 dancers – all sharing the same passion for dance and performing. Over 70 dancers, of all levels of experience, have been given the opportunity to perform on stage in 2013. 


Our Creation: Performance Series

In this year’s Summer Performance Series we have 23 pieces and a total of 48 performers. Our dancers train intensely for 13 weeks, many training in various styles and dancing numerous pieces. The end result is a comprehensive, multi-disciplinary performance on a live stage with music, lights and costumes! This is an opportunity to not only showcase the hard work and dedication of the previous 13 weeks, but to tell a story through our movement and passion.

The Goal = $8,537.00

As a fiscally sponsored group of Fractured Atlas, Allure Dance DC is asking for your support to help us reach our goal and share in our love of dance! We have set a bold company goal to raise $8,537.00 together for our Summer Performance Series. 

How We Will Use The Funds

Your tax-deductible donation money would help cover the following costs:

  • Our performance venue $3250
  • Quality and professional costumes for each dancer $4355
  • Fees that accumulate for studio rental and rehearsal time $932

Why costumes? Professional quality costumes are an important part of our success and continued growth. Professional quality costumes polish the dance piece, they set the mood of the piece, accentuate the choreography, and most importantly they make the dancer feel good. When you feel good onstage you give your best performance.

With your help, we can take our production to a higher level of artistic quality and professionalism.

Even if we do not reach our goal, whatever money is raised will be split between venue fees and costumes. 

Perks

Our perks are listed to the right and include:

  • Our sincerest thanks
  • A mention in our program
  • An add in our program
  • A complimentary dance class (to be used during designated dates/times at open drop-in classes only)
  • Tickets to our performance with priority seating
  • An invitation to attend our dress rehearsal
  • Our dancers at your event!

At the $1000 donation level we offer a special perk: Our dancers at your event! 

Throwing a dance themed kids birthday party? We will send our ballerinas in costume to meet your party & lead a short exercise with the children. 

Having a Halloween bash? We will send our dancers to perform Michael Jackson's "Thriller" as a special treat to entertain your guests! 

Hosting a gala? Our contemporary dancers are available to perform a sophisticated, beautiful piece to enhance your guests' experience. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to make a donation, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Share:  Please help spread the word about our campaign through social media using the Indiegogo “share” tools.
  • Attend:  Come see our performance! You can attend our performance to see our final product, support our dancers and the arts in your community!

JUNE 28TH & 29TH,  2014 at the SYNETIC THEATER in CRYSTAL CITY, VA.

  • Be Social:  You can also follow Allure Dance DC on Facebook www.facebook.com/alluredancedc and on Twitter @AllureDanceDc to stay up-to-date with our company and upcoming performances.

With our most sincere appreciation and gratitude, we thank you for taking the time to read about us, assist in our journey and fund our project.

story:
SynthesisDANCE has been invited to perform in the Booking Dance Festival in Edinburgh Scotland August 11-17. We are beyond excited to be asked to return again this year. Last year marked the company's first international festival. We met theatre presenters, industry professionals, agents and received rave reviews! This performance in the festival will allow us the opportunity to build on our momentum from last year and solidify international relationships for possible touring and residencies.

Our budget for this production is over $21,000. We are seeking $7000 through this Indiegogo campaign as well as accepting contributions through our fiscal sponsor, Fractured Atlas. We are also holding workshops, coaching, bake sales and performances to aid in the cause. Your support would mean the world to us! Every dollar counts and we are grateful to all of our friends and supporters.

The Huffington Post UK: "thrilled and mesmerized with masterful fusion of contemporary and classical techniques"

Scotsman News: "Four Stars! A Standout."

Synthesis Dance Project celebrates athleticism, vitality and pure dance through passionate performances. Firmly grounded in classical technique and drawing from all styles of movement, Synthesis Dance Project combines the daring rebellion of modern movement with the rhythm and pulse of jazz dance. We invite the audience into the world of honest emotion and bold ideas through thoughtful and expressive work that challenges the boundaries of any singular dance genre. The company’s vibrant and magnetic energy bursts off the stage during sold out performances and standing ovations.

If you are able to become part of the SynthesisDANCE support team, we thank you and welcome you to the family! 

If you are unable to contribute at this time, we appreciate your helping us promote this fundraising campaign! THANK YOU.

story:
This summer, Far Corners Community Musical Theatre is putting on a Spanish-language production of The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee with a cast of local teens from Monteverde, Costa Rica. Spelling Bee will be our 8th musical in Monteverde!

What is Far Corners?
Far Corners is a small, U.S. based non-profit dedicated to bringing arts education to underserved youth in isolated regions of the world. This summer, we have a full-time staff of 7 mounting a fully-realized musical with twenty teens from every part of the zone. 

The teens we work with LOVE to sing, dance and act. But they don't have very many opportunities to participate in the arts in the small mountain town where they live. They look forward all year to participating in the musical, and every year new kids join in.

"Far Corners helped me become comfortable with my self  and who I was as a person and helped me find my identity."  
-Jonathan Garner 
      3-time participant, 1st time Stage Manager this year

$6 to Succeed -
Join the Far Corners Movement!
Far Corners Community Musical Theatre currently has a little over 1,000 likes on our Facebook page. 1,000 people who believe in our mission. 1,000 people, like you, who want to empower underserved youth throughout the world through arts education. 

Our goal is to raise a little more than $6,000 for our 2014 Indiegogo campaign. That means we only need $6 from each of our fans to reach our fundraising goal. Only $6 from each of you to succeed! 

$6 could buy you a sandwich, or a venti coffee, or 24 gumballs. OR $6 could provide opportunities for a whole community to engage with the performing arts! So, skip your coffee one morning and give $6 to Succeed!



Where will my money go?

Musical theater is expensive - especially in the isolated mountains of Costa Rica. We try to bring as many supplies as we can, but our suitcases can only hold so many microphones. 

Your money will not only go towards production costs: sound and lighting equipment, set pieces, costumes, make up, paint, scripts, royalties, musicians, props, and so on. But it also helps support our program as a whole, providing us with the ability to make copies, print posters, advertise to more members of the community, provide transportation for students who come up to an hour away for rehearsal, 

In an effort to continue to expand our offerings, this year, for the first time, we want to bring the performances out of the theatre and into the local schools, so that even MORE young people in the community can learn about our work.


Why do you need my money?
The community of Monteverde is incredibly supportive of our work. Local businesses sponsor the show, families sell baked goods to raise money for the production, and audience members buy tickets. But there is no way that we could raise all of the money for the show without outside help: in Costa Rica, the average annual household income is about $6000.

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE OUR SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM POSSIBLE!

Our mission: Far Corners Community Musical Theatre is committed to providing diverse youth populations from communities around the world with new opportunities, through committed participation in the performing arts, to grow and succeed as collaborators, performers, thinkers, creators, change-makers, multilingual communicators, and open-minded, responsible members of a global community.
story_txt:
This summer, Far Corners Community Musical Theatre is putting on a Spanish-language production of The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee with a cast of local teens from Monteverde, Costa Rica. Spelling Bee will be our 8th musical in Monteverde!What is Far Corners?Far Corners is a small, U.S. based non-profit dedicated to bringing arts education to underserved youth in isolated regions of the world. This summer, we have a full-time staff of 7 mounting a fully-realized musical with twenty teens from every part of the zone. The teens we work with LOVE to sing, dance and act. But they don't have very many opportunities to participate in the arts in the small mountain town where they live. They look forward all year to participating in the musical, and every year new kids join in.
"Far Corners helped me become comfortable with my self  and who I was as a person and helped me find my identity."  -Jonathan Garner       3-time participant, 1st time Stage Manager this year

But there is no way that we could raise all of the money for the show without outside help: in Costa Rica, the average annual household income is about $6000.WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE OUR SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM POSSIBLE!Our mission: Far Corners Community Musical Theatre is committed to providing diverse youth populations from communities around the world with new opportunities, through committed participation in the performing arts, to grow and succeed as collaborators, performers, thinkers, creators, change-makers, multilingual communicators, and open-minded, responsible members of a global community.

story:
"Somewhere new. Somewhere new and wonderful. Somewhere we’ll visit together some day."

Jack is stressed. It's Christmas in his new London home. An old pal is bringing her overbearing boyfriend to visit. And his Irish Catholic parents are about to meet his own boyfriend for the first time. Memories and tensions are bubbling to the surface but Jack has an escape plan. Sort of. 

From the company behind hit show ‘In Dog Years I’m Dead’ (winner, Stewart Parker Award 2014), this new play examines what three couples risk when striving for happiness as they clash over pasts, presents and futures. 

‘Our Island’ deals with contemporary and relevant issues of emigration, homosexuality, relationships and choices with humour, a fresh perspective and a new youthful voice.

It is a play that looks at what happens after the referendum in Ireland has passed, and what impact it will have on domestic relationships. How do people adjust to life after May 22nd, to a new world with the same old questions? How do we judge each other's decisions and how do they reflect on our own choices? How do we bridge that gap between an old home and a new life?

'Our Island' will be performed in the Tiger Dublin Fringe Festival, September 2015.

Meet The Team

Barry McStay is an Irish actor turned playwright who currently lives in London. This is his first play, which has been developed in association with the Abbey Theatre, Dublin and Old Vic New Voices, London.

Director Maisie Lee is Artistic Director of MIRARI Productions and has directed all of the company's plays to date, including the award winning In Dog Year's I'm Dead. She was Resident Assistant Director in the Abbey Theatre, Dublin from 2013 -14. 

Sound Designer and composer Philip Stewart has written music and sound design for a broad range of mediums including theatre, sound installations, dance, shorts and documentary film making. His work includes designing award winning shows ‘Our Few and Evil Days’ and ‘Howie the Rookie’. 

Set and Costume Designer Rebekka Duffy studied stage design at IT Sligo She recently completed a six month design internship in the Abbey Theatre, where she worked as Design Assistant for the Abbey Theatre’s ‘A Midsummer Night’s Dream’. 

Sarah Jayne Quigley is the Associate director for MIRARI Productions. Sarah Jayne is a co-founder of Mirari Productions. She acts as production and creative support for all Mirari’s productions.

Producer Jan Schneider has previously produced Neil Watkin's Dinner and a Show in 2013. In the meantime he directed 'Eight Women' and is currently working as the Casting Assistant in the Abbey Theatre.


Why do we need your support.

In producing ‘Our Island’ we want to stand up, declare and celebrate a new narrative. It is simply a play about couples, and ultimately about people, struggling to make sense of their world. This feels like an important play for today’s changing world. For today's changing Ireland.

In order for us to make this production happen we need your help:

  • We want to pay all actors and designers a fair fee, that values their work, time and artistic impact on the production
  • We need to build a set, make costumes and cover costs for lighting and sound
  • The goal is to raise €5000, this money will not cover all the costs but will be an important and valuable contribution 

The Impact

Making a new play a reality in today's world is a challenging process. It takes so much more than a great idea, a fantastic creative team, passion and ambition. It takes resources, and more and more in recent times, it takes the good will of friends, family and people who believe in your idea.
We believe that 'Our Island' is touching on very timely and current issues in our society, and asks questions that many people can relate to.
By supporting this production, you will directly impact on making our idea a reality and become a part of the 'Our Island'-family. A relationship that will hopefully last.

story:
My name is Margaret Phyllis Johnson and I am a dancer, mover, maker and creator. I am currently a Junior BFA candidate at Seattle’s Cornish College of the Arts where I have the privilege of learning ballet and modern technique as well as choreographic and somatic practices. I have created this fundraiser to help me get to Colorado this summer for the Boulder Jazz Dance Workshop (BJDW) and to dance as an apprentice for Interweave Dance Theater (IDT).

Last summer I had the privilege of attending Boulder Jazz Dance Workshop in Colorado and found that it has been one of the most valuable and exciting experiences in my artistic education. Attended by amazingly talented faculty and students, the intensive offers a massive variety of technique classes (including jazz, modern, contemporary, ballet) as well as compositional feedback classes. Last summer I had the opportunity to choreograph a piece and set it on dancers at the workshop; this included outside networking, daily rehearsals, and application of feedback from faculty during the Choreo-Feedback course. By the end of the two weeks I hadn't only choreographed and set a full-length work, but designed lights, costumes, and sound, ultimately presenting my piece Who Are You? in the BJDW show for students, artists, and dance enthusiasts from all over Colorado to view. As a budding choreographer, it was an amazing opportunity and an invaluable learning experience. This summer, I intend to attend Boulder Jazz Dance Workshop to further expand my experience as a dancer and choreographer, improve my technique, and continue my education as a performer by working with Interweave Dance Theater

Interweave Dance Theater is a professional performing company in residence at BJDW each year. Although the company is not attached to the intensive itself, IDT has become an integral part of the festival, offering the opportunity for select students to perform with them each season. Having auditioned for the company last July, I am truly honored to have received an apprentice position for their 36th season, Le Cirque de la Lune.

This intensive and my apprenticeship will help my technique, artistry, and kick-start my professional career; summer intensives not only augment dance education as a whole, but play a vital role in establishing much-needed connections with other artists – in the US and beyond. Working with IDT is a truly profound opportunity and I can’t express my excitement at having been selected for the summer season.

Here’s the catch: I am currently a full-time student in the arts (sometimes dancing 14 hour days) and I work two part-time jobs every chance I have in order to live and pay for my education. I’m 21, live on my own and do not receive much aid, my family is only able to give me minimal financial help. Although I will be working immensely hard to save money for this trip, I would appreciate any financial help I can get to make this endeavor a reality. The money, should you choose to donate, will go towards airplane tickets, the cost of the intensive, and cost of living (housing, food, laundry, etc.). I completely understand if you are unable to donate, but if you know any dance enthusiasts please pass the message along!

Many thanks,

Margaret Johnson

story:
The Discordia Days Burlesque Festival (Formerly the Purrrlesque Follies)

We are Greensboro's only Burlesque Festival, and we are the only burlesque festival in the state which gives all our proceeds to charity. Everything outside of our production costs goes to our selected charity. In the past, we've donated to Girls Rock NC, the Merit Pitbull Foundation and the Sheree Denise Jackson Foundation. This year we will be donating towards Triad AIDS Care Services, a wonderful organization that helps those living with the disease. We need your help! The more we can raise towards our production costs, the more of our ticket sales can go towards Triad AIDS Care. 


What We Are Asking For. 

We are asking for $1000. This will pay almost of our production costs.This will go towards paying the travel costs for our headliner, venue rental, promotional materials and liability insurance. For your donation you'll receive special, one of a kind merch, show tickets, and VIP seating and perks. Anything over will go towards producing the 2016 festival. 

Why We Do This. 

We do this to bring fun, positivity and female empowered activism to downtown Greensboro. Greensboro is our home, our heart and soul. We want to do our part to  give it the thriving arts scene Greensboro deserves. We also want to show that there's power in art, power in sexuality and power in femininity. We've raised thousands of dollars in the past for several different organizations. The Discordia Dames Festival will bring together performers from all over the country to cause direct change in our community. 

Risks & Challenges

How much money we raise will directly affect how much the charity gets. The more we can get here, the more Triad AIDS Care will receive.

What happens when you mix a dash of Paris with a little Vegas...?  Join HER. Dance Co for an enticing evening of love, lust, and emotion. The ladies will take you on a roller coaster ride never denying that every HER. needs a him.

We can't wait to entertain you! Please help our company bring you the best show possible.  HER. needs $2000 to cover expenses including venue, costuming, props and videography.  LUXURE is something totally different for the Denver eye and with a little help, can go above and beyond.

story:
Help Us Dance Our Way To Wellness

My name is Lana King and I am the Program Director at A Place For Miracles Las Vegas, (2160 W. Charleston Blvd., Suites C & B, Las Vegas, NV 89102.) We are a Non-Denominational, Christian Based Church, (A Non-Profit Organization.) As Program Director, I oversee many projects, but the InLight Beginner Line Dance Class, I started in February of this year, is very special to me. We have over 30 students of various ages, mobility and wellness levels. Health and Wellness is near and dear to my heart because, through diet and exercise, I have lost over 300 pounds in the last 3 years. Even though the reason for my extreme weight gain was medical, in the end I chose a weight loss strategy that included a low carb. diet and exercise, (http://www.lasvegas.va.gov/services/Move_Program.asp) I have experienced several medical conditions completely reversing as a result of my weight loss and continued diet changes. I am a Veteran of The US Marine Corps and through the Southern Nevada VA Healthcare System, I participate in the VA’s weight management program, (MOVE Program.) Through this program, I have learned the importance of knowing how the body works and what it needs to become/stay healthy & well. Exercise is an essential component of achieving and maintaining wellness, but it can be a chore. That’s why it’s so important to find ways to exercise that are fun, challenging and rewarding. Line Dancing has been all that for me and now I get to pass that on to others. I am truly thankful that, A Place For Miracles LV was made available to me to have our dance classes, but the room we use is carpeted and challenging to dance on. Some have complained that it is hard on their feet, ankles and knees. We recently had a trial with a portable dance floor and the difference was amazing!!! Now we are dreaming of the possibilities having a “real” dance floor can bring to us. We can hold other types of dance lessons and exercise classes, as well. We already have a brilliant Ballroom & Latin Dance Instructor in the wings, who’s agreed to facilitate classes, if we have the proper flooring. SwissTrax, (www.swissfloors.com) is the flooring company that gave me the best pricing to purchase the amount of floor tiles we would need for our space. The owner, Ed Nelson and his crew are the best!!! Please help me to help others in my quest to bring more fun, joy, laughs, pride and great health to our Las Vegas residents, by making a donation towards the purchase of our new dance floor!!! Please share our story with your friends, family and associates as well, (see IndieGoGo share tools.) Thank you, in advance for your generous support!!! Come to Vegas and visit the InLight Line Dance Classes while you’re here!!!
 Peace & Blessings,
 Lana King.

story:
Short Summary

South Hills Classics, part of the South Hills Players, proudly presents William Shakespeare’s tragedy Julius Caesar directed by Robert Scott.

The South Hills Players, formerly the Baldwin Players, have been entertaining audiences with quality theater productions for over 50 years.

South Hills Classics Edition is a new venture aimed at bringing classic plays to modern audiences at a low cost. Julius Caesar is the inaugural production to kick off this series.

Performance dates are August 7-9 and 14-16. Performances will be split between the Emmanuel Lutheran Church in Castle Shannon (matinees) and evening shows at the Grand Theater in Elizabeth. 

What We Need & What You Get

YOU can help to bring Shakespeare’s play to life.  Your contributions will go toward the venues, costumes, props, makeup and tech.

The Impact

Julius Caesar , a tale of political intrigue, conspiracy and civil war, is as timely and relevant today as it was in ancient Rome and Elizabethan England.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially you can still help.

  • Help to get the word out about our production via social media, email and good old-fashioned word-of-mouth.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
What is This...?

The Female Pirate Project is a devised immersive shadow puppetry piece that examines the history of female pirates. What made these incredible and dangerous women choose this life, as opposed to a more conventional path?

The piece is broken into 5 parts: Revenge, Justice, Adventure & Escape, Power and Survival.

With this piece, we are pushing the boundaries of immersive shadow puppetry: experimenting with where to cast shadows, continually surprising the audience. Come go sea with us, drink rum with us, sing along with us, go on this journey with us…

Who Are We...?

Director: Gretchen Van Lente
Costume Designer: Emily Blumenauer
Vocal coach: Amy Carrigan
Publicist: Emily Owens, PR

ENSEMBLE
Joseph Garner
Emily Hartford
Gretchen Van Lente
Scott Weber
Meghan Williams

http://www.dramaofworks.com/#!pirates/cb3i

Special thanks to our puppet-building helpers: Andrea Chrem, Janet Clancy, Tara Conlon, Claudia Orenstein, Lucinda Williams

ILLUSTRATION BY JAMES WALTON

Where does the money go...?

There are many things we need to make this show the best it can possibly be:

  • Paying our artists what they're worth
  • Paying the rent on the barge
  • Paying the designers
  • Paying the publicist (if no one comes, is it really theater?)
  • Buying sails and fabric
  • Buying puppet and costume supplies
  • Buying new shadow lights


Other Ways You Can Help...

Come out to see the show!

story_txt:
What is This...? 
The Female Pirate Project is a devised immersive
shadow puppetry piece that examines the history of female pirates. What made
these incredible and dangerous women choose this life, as opposed to a more
conventional path? 
The piece is broken into 5 parts: Revenge,
Justice, Adventure & Escape, Power and Survival. 
With this piece, we are pushing the boundaries
of immersive shadow puppetry: experimenting with where to cast shadows,
continually surprising the audience. Come go sea with us, drink rum with us,
sing along with us, go on this journey with us…
   Who Are We...? 
Director: Gretchen Van LenteCostume Designer: Emily
BlumenauerVocal coach: Amy CarriganPublicist: Emily Owens, PR
ENSEMBLEJoseph GarnerEmily HartfordGretchen Van LenteScott WeberMeghan Williams
http://www.dramaofworks.com/#!pirates/cb3i
Special thanks to our
puppet-building helpers: Andrea Chrem, Janet Clancy, Tara Conlon, Claudia
Orenstein, Lucinda Williams
ILLUSTRATION BY JAMES WALTON   Where does the money go...? There are many things we need to make this show the best it can possibly be:  Paying our artists what they're worth
Paying the rent on the barge
Paying the designers
Paying the publicist (if no one comes, is it really theater?)
Buying sails and fabric
Buying puppet and costume supplies
Buying new shadow lights    
    Other Ways You Can Help... Come out to see the show!
http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/1409315 
https://www.facebook.com/events/681630545293726/
DONATE to the general Drama of Works fund:http://www.dramaofworks.com/#!support/cbtw

story:
Hi, I'm Charley Ramsay age 14. I have been dancing for 10 years and I'm currently in the 6th level of the intensive training program at Halifax Dance, in Halifax, NS, Canada. I love to dance because it allows me to express emotions I other wise would not be able to express. With dance I can release stress from school and home life that I don't know how to cope with other wise. Every year we do ballet exams and I have earned the top mark of distinction all 5 years (we haven't gotten results back from this year yet). In 2011, I was awarded the Neste Toumine award for dancing the best exam in Canada for my age. I have been in The Nutcracker presented by Symphony Nova Scotia, Halifax Dance, and Mermaid Theatre of Nova Scotia for the past 4 years. It is long hours and a lot of rehearsing, but I love being on stage and being part of the cast so this my fave time of the year! 

This year I have been invited to attend the Alberta Ballet summer intensive and Canada's National Ballet School summer intensive . I have chosen to go to the National Ballet School because it seems like the best fit for me. I went to the NBS in the summer of 2011, but I was too young to audition for their full time professional program. I enjoyed it very much and waited until this year to audition again. Going to the summer intensive this year means I will be auditioning for their full time professional program which starts in September and goes until June. NBS offers scholarships and bursaries for their full time professional students, but not for their summer intensive program. Being in the NBS as a professional full time student is my ultimate goal and dream and in order to achieve this, I have to go to the summer intensive. 

Reasons I want to go:

-This is a huge opportunity where I get to learn and grow as a ballet dancer.

-I will get to meet many other dancers from all over the country!

-I will get to work with amazing teachers who will teach me many new things.

-Karen Kain is my idol and is the artistic director at NBS!

Dancing is my passion and I really want to be able to pursue it at Canada's National Ballet School!  It is an amazing opportunity and I would love to take it!

Thank you for considering!

-Charley Ramsay

story:
I have been given the incredible opportunity to participate in the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, a once in a lifetime opportunity to live abroad for one month performing 6 days a week. I was cast as one of the leading roles (Ferulic Maydie) in a brilliant new piece, IamI, that has been accepted to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, the largest arts festival in the world with up-and-coming talents working alongside renowned artists. This show will be performed at CalArts, Studio RedCat LA, The Hollywood Fringe and The Edinburgh Fringe Festival! 

However, I need your help to get me there! I'm a full time BFA acting student with a partial scholarship at California Institute of the Arts. I work a part-time job to help sustain myself while in school and pay rent. I'm blessed to have parents who have helped support with college funding as well as living when they can but they aren't able to help me with this project being that my father is unfortunately not in good health right now. 

For this reason I am reaching out to family, friends, and peers to help make this dream a reality. 

Any amount helps and is greatly appreciated. If you cannot help, please spread the word about this incredible opportunity and my campaign!

story:
Short Summary

Lollapacoacharoozastock Music Festival, appearing in the New York International Fringe Festival in August 2013, is a rock concert of fake bands that spoofs the spectrum of pop music with original songs and characters. It's the only music festival you can afford to go to this year! First performed at The Groundlings Theater in Los Angeles, the Fringe will mark our East Coast debut. Creating and developing this show has been a labor of love over the last 3 years, and putting the show up in FringeNYC is an incredible opportunity for us. Please help us by donating however much you are able, to support this production to reach its full potential to shine!

About Lolla

Written by Adam Blotner

Directed by Phyllis Katz

Musically Directed by Matt Tobin

Featuring Adam Blotner & Jenny Pinzari, with The Positive Feedback Band: Joe Headrick, Daniel Namm, Matt Tobin, and Danny Weller.

FOR INFO ON SHOW DATES AND TICKETS please visit: http://www.PositiveFeedbackRocks.com

What We Need & What You Get

We have a lot of incredibly necessary though terribly boring things to pay for, which include:

  • Festival Fees
  • Insurance
  • Staff
  • Marketing
  • Sound Equipment
  • Rehearsal Space Rentals

But the fun part is the incentives we are going to give you for your support! We really hope you take advantage of them! They're a Positive Feedback fan's dreams come true.

Thank you so much for your support, it means the world to us.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are in need of people to help us distribute postcards and flyers, spread the word about the show, and a few hands to help out at the show itself. If you are interested in getting involved beyond your financial contribution, please send an email to: Taylor@PositiveFeedbackRocks.com

 

THANK YOU!!

Adam

story:
Our Story

Hello Everyone, My name is Malcolm Low and I am the artistic director of my NYC based company Malcolm Low/Formal Structure. I have been showcasing my work in NYC since 1999. I have recently been blessed with the opportunity to showcase my work as part of the 2011-2012 Joyce Soho Season. I will be premiering my newest work "Collapsing Giant" a work that takes a look into what is reality and the world in which we live in the context of what we do while we are here (i.e. love , gain knowledge, war and death.) I will be working in collaboration with lighting and set designer, Gregory Bain, and seven beautiful dancers. With big opportunity comes big expenses and this is where your generous support is most needed. Please help us bring Collapsing Giant into fruition at the Joyce Soho March 2nd and 3rd.


Here is a brief biography:


Malcolm Low is a participant in the 2011 Alvin Ailey Dance Foundation New Directions Choreography Lab made possible by generous support from the Ford Foundation. Mr. Low is orginally from Chicago where he first trained with Joseph Holmes Chicago, Hubbard Street Dance Chicago, Homer Bryyant and the Ruth Page Foundation. Low went on to perform with Joseph Holmes Chicago Dance Co., Les Ballets Jazz de Montreal, Ballet British Columbia, Ronald K. Brown/Evidence, Stephen Peternio, Complexions, Zvi Gotheneir and Dancers, Margo Sappington and most notably the Bill T. Jones/ Arnie Zane Dance Co., where he had the great pleasure of touring with Bill T. Jones on his solo show As I Was Saying. Recently, he has been working with Crystal Pite and her company KIDD PIVOT on the project LOST ACTION. Low has been showing work in NYC since 1999: at the River to River Festival in collaboration with DJ Spooky (2003), The House That Jack Built at DanceNow (2009), Catch N Release Variation #35 at Harlem Stage/Emoves (2009), and Luscious Colors of an Unclear Canvas at the Wave Rising Series (2009)
Uneven Wall False Security/HOME Wave Rising Series(2010) Pushing Against Sisyphus at Brooklyn Art Exchange(2011).


The Impact

This campaign includes the work of many types artists: dancers, set and costume designers, photographers, and videographers. So regardless of what area of the arts you have an interest in, by supporting our campaign you are supporting the arts!!


What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,000 to have a successful and quality premiere of Collapsing Giant. Here is what your donations will cover:

-Artist Fees

-Production Fees (lighting designer, sets, props)

-Costumes for 7 dancers

-Rehearsal Space

-Videographer and Photographer


The smallest donation would really offset any of these costs! No donation is too small!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with friends, family, and other dance enthusiasts AND by join us for our Joyce Soho Season March 2nd and 3rd.


For more information please visit our website: http://www.wix.com/malcolmlow/formalstructure

story:
Who we are

A Dance Can is a New York City based movement company founded in 2011 by Sarah Horne. The purpose of the A Dance Can is to encourage choreographic innovation and exploration while also collaborating with varying organizations and communities to make positive social change.

What we're doing

Currently we are producing a show called A Modern Tribute. The choreographers are using their artistic voices to create modern tributes to musical legends. The show is bringing together dancers and choreographers from all over the city. A Dance Can is covering all the administrative costs so that the other seven artists being showcased can focus on their work. These artists willingly applied to the show knowing they would not get compensated - but that doesn't seem right! So, we are trying to raise money for them...

These are the talented companies and artists that will be represented:

Antonio Brown
Grace Courvoisier Dance Company
LorenaEganDance
Leah Fox
LiNK! the movement
ModArts Dance Collective
Jennifer Pommiss

The show is being held at The Center for Performance Research on Friday, November 30 and Saturday, December 1. Both shows start at 7:30pm and there will be a reception each night...

Tickets are only $10 in advance. You can purchase them here: http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/296489

Your impact

Many of these choreographers and dancers work, rehearse, and perform for free. They spend numerous hours every week, if not everyday, to create art and share it with you. More often than not, dancers and dance-makers do not get compensated for their hard work. They work full-time or multiple part-time jobs to make ends meet. It would be nice to reverse that for a change and compensate them for their artistic contributions.

The Breakdown

As you can see - we've been busy organizing a great show. But we need
your help! Production costs are high and we can't afford to pay the choreographers, let alone the performers, unless we raise more money. Your contribution will support these choreographers and fuel future artistic productions. With a donation of just $20 or more, you will have a huge part in helping us make this goal.

If we reach our goal, we will evenly split the money eight ways and give it to the choreographers so that they can disperse the funds as they see fit. If we don't reach our goal, we will take any funds raised and evenly split that. If we make more than our goal, than we'll be able to offer the choreographers even more and save some for future productions. 

What else?

In light of our mission to collaborate with organizations to make positive social change, the show will he held at the Center for Performance Research (CPR), a “green” theater in Williamsburg. They are the original L.E.E.D. certified building of its kind in Brooklyn. And, we are also collaborating with Community Markets to support eco-friendly living!

The Ways You Can Help

In exchange for specific donation amounts, you can get some great benefits! Check out our perks to the left. However, you don't have to give those specific amounts - anything helps!

If you can't contribute monetarily - you can still help! Please share our campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, and/or anyone who think would want to see this. You can also "like" us on Facebook (www.facebook.com/adancecan)...you can get the word out via Facebook and other social media outlets. You can also use Indiegogo's share tools!

 

Thank you for your support. From sending this to a friend, to making a contribution, to just reading this - your participation means everything to us.

See you at the show!

story:
Our Story

 

L.A.'s all-female Vox Dance Theatre and the musical artists, Musicàntica, are finally touring our new program! The complete Fimmine, Artistic Director Sarah Swenson's signature work, and our latest project, Brigantesse, with live music by Enzo Fina & Roberto Catalano of Musicàntica, will premiere in Mexico! (And by the way, we just became a 501.c3 tax-exempt nonprofit corporation! Your donations will be tax-exempt to the extent of the law!)

 

Enzo and Roberto are from southern Italy, and Sarah is an Italian-American, with roots in Sicily. The two groups have come together to create Brigantesse, featuring the lives of some very fierce Italian women from 19th-century southern Italian history, combined with the ancient music of that region. The complete work will premiere at the City Theatre of Ensenada, Mexico (Teatro de la Ciudad de Ensenada) on October 20, followed by three more performances in the Baja region. Musicàntica will begin the program with a live musical set that segues into Brigantesse, and the acclaimed Fimmine, with music by Philip Glass will conclude Act II.

 

This is a tight tour, with four performances in four days, but we hope to hold workshops for community performance participation in both Fimmine and Brigantesse, as well as music and dance workshops for pleasure and education, which we provide at NO EXTRA COST to the presenters or the communities.


Who's going?  Hope Bataclan,  Erin Bond, Tamsin Carlson,  Roberto Catalano, Amainary Contreras, Ali Daniels, Enzo Fina, Katrina Obarski, Andrew Palomares, Katy Tabb, & Sarah Swenson.

 

The Impact

 

Vox Dance Theatre's programming is enriching and thought-provoking and our collaborators, Enzo & Roberto of Musicàntica, have a unique sound that is very moving and exciting. If we don't make our goal, we will have trouble paying bills. Vox Dance Theatre has offered free and low cost services to the community for years, including open rehearsals, free company class, workshops for children and teens, and more. If we don't break even, it is difficult to maintain our ongoing projects.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Not all of the real expenses of the tour are being covered by the fee, so we need to supplement our income to help keep us liquid! In addition to performer and staff pay, there are additional costs in costume repair, insurance, and cleaning bills we'd really appreciate some help with. If we don't make our goal, any money raised will first be applied to dancer pay. Dancers are notoriously underpaid, and seldom get what they deserve. If we exceed our goal, all the expenses of the tour will be met, and any excess will be applied to future rehearsal stipends and rehearsal studio rent, which is very costly. Our dedicated Board of Directors donates a great deal but they can't compensate for every under-funded project. Small donations from a lot of people will go a long way for Vox Dance Theatre...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Share this campaign with friends, family, co-workers, other dancers and musicians.  Please Tweet and share on Facebook....Direct people to our websites to find out more about VoxDanceTheare.org and Musicantica.org!  Thanks so much!

story:
WHO WE ARE

Schaubühne Lindenfels in Leipzig is a modern theatre in an old magnificant building that was previously used as a ballroom.  

Nowadays it is furthermore not only a theatre but a place where different art-forms meet. With a selective and varied programme, the Schaubühne has built up its unmistakable identity. The secret is the combination of theatrical art, film, music, literature and various festivals, supplemented by new media and fine arts. Complemented by a coffee shop and restaurant, Schaubühne Lindenfels is one of the places to be in the city of Leipzig.

We are proud that our theatre is owned by a community of more than 1000 people. As one of the first cultural institutions in Germany we are constituted as a nonprofit limited company.

The Schaubühne Lindenfels premise was built in 1876 as a dance hall and was at that time one of the largest and most important establishments in Leipzig. In the historic ballroom one can sense the glamour of bygone times still today.

Due to our great success during the last season we are in need for a new seating for our growing audience. It's especially essential for our own theatre-productions, precisely our upcoming premiere of "Die Spieler" ("The Gamblers", based on Dostojewski's novel). 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Especially for our theatre-activities in the beautiful old ballroom we need a grandstand that is licensed (you know... German law!) and is easily removable and modifiable. The relationship between actors and spectators within the theater space is questioned in all of our works in different ways. That's why the grandstand should give us the opportunity to change the situation for the audience for each production and within. 

We would like to buy 150 seats that fulfill all these requirements. Therefore we need $12 000. 

With your contribution you will become part of upcoming productions and the institution too and therefore get on with our idea of a shared theatre: If you give $70 or more, your name will be engraved in one of the seats. Depending on the amount of your support you will furthermore get an impression from the production in form of a DVD, free entrance to one of our events (valid for one year!) and/or - as long as we are a nonprofit limited company. (Please find more information on the limited company on our profile.) And how does a paid flight to Leipzig sounds like? 

Additional funds will be used for our next production, most probably for the stage setting. If we shouldn't reach the entire goal we won't be able to buy as many new chairs as needed for our audience. 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Please help us with sharing this campaign with friends and via your social networks.

WHO WE ARE
Schaubühne Lindenfels in Leipzig is a modern theatre in an old magnificant building that was previously used as a ballroom.  
Nowadays it is furthermore not only a theatre but a place where different art-forms meet. With a selective and varied programme, the Schaubühne has built up its unmistakable identity. story:
HELLO FRIENDS, COLLEAGUES AND PATRONS OF THE ARTS:  THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST IN HELPING THE BROADWAY DOLLS MAKE THEIR DREAM A REALITY!


  • Our Story  "TOUR DE FIERCE":  Girl Group meets Broadway is coming to the New York Musical Theatre Festival on October 11, 2011!  This ambitious new stage production mixes elements of Broadway, Cabaret, Fashion and Performance Art, in a non-stop song-and-dance concert. Starring The Broadway Dolls, a girl group featuring five of the most fiercely talented, sexy, and intelligent triple-threat ingénues of the Broadway Stage – accomplished and contemporary women who tell the stories of their road to Broadway in a surprising, moving and often hilarious evening of theatrical fabulousness. In a word, FIERCE. 
DONATE! This is where we need your help! $5 will pay for a roll of microphone tape, $500 will pay for a graphic designer, $3000 will pay for rehearsal space or $5000 will pay for costumes. OUR GOAL IS TO RAISE: $12,000

Send us $5, $15, $20, $100... or $1000, $5000, $10,000.   Through the New York Musical Theatre Festival, we have set up a 501C organization- all donations are tax deductible by law. https://www.nymf.org/donatetotourdefierce  

MEET THE CAST

Tracee Beazer (Memphis, Hairspray, Good Vibrations, The Wedding Singer)

Hollie Howard (Mamma Mia, Hairspray, Annie Get Your Gun, A Chorus Line)

Tracy Jai Edwards (Legally Blonde, Hairspray)

Robyn Hurder (Grease, Chitty Chitty Bang Bany, Wedding Singer,Spamalot)

Chelsea Morgan Stock (The Little Mermaid, Baby It's You)

Gabrielle Ruiz (In the Heights, A Chorus Line)

MEET THE CREATIVE TEAM

Conceived by Hollie Howard and Joey Murray

 Directed by Joey Murray

Music Direction by David Kreppel 

Choreography by Jordan Fife Hunt

Music Coordinated by Barbara Helms  

Additional Music by Rob Baumgartner

The Broadway Dolls Created by Hollie Howard
















A NOTE FROM THE WRITERS  It is a great honor to be asked to be a part of The New York Musical Theatre Festival (NYMF) - and we are really thrilled to be in the company of so many esteemed artists working on shows for the Festival this year!  The Broadway Dolls has become to center of both of our lives for over a year now, and this marks a turning point in both of our careers and for this brand in general.  We have custom built a premiere stage production for NYMF this year, entitled TOUR DE FIERCE! and we are waiting with baited breath to share it with you!  As you might imagine, though it is a great honor to be invited into the New York Musical Theatre Festival, this comes with great expense and a tremendous price tag.  Producing theatre in New York City is wildly expensive and therefore, we are looking for gifts to make our dream come true.  And by gifts, we actually mean money, no matter how large or small the donation, every cent helps us in making our production come to fruition.  

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your time in reading our donations guide and for patronizing the arts - what we believe to be the greatest entity in the universe, and what makes us tick.  The arts are the beating heart of this amazing and impossible city - the home of Broadway - and by a donation of any size, you are contributing to a dream fulfilled. 

 With Love and Respect, Joey Murray and Hollie Howard


GOALS OF TOUR DE FIERCE Our major goal from participating in The New York Musical Theatre Festival is to book a touring production of Tour De Fierce!  NYMF is providing our company with exposure to the New York theatrical community as a presence in New York is of utmost importance in building the brand of The Broadway Dolls.  Furthermore, a touring production helps to create presence and exposure to the entire nation.  Of course we would love to have a production running here in our home of Manhattan, however we are willing to take the necessary steps to gain exposure before that can happen.  We believe that TOUR DE FIERCE! is a stage production that can be enjoyed by audiences of all ages and walks of life, and that there is tremendous commercial potential in this production.  Though TOUR DE FIERCE! is the edgiest of any Broadway Dolls production to date, it is appropriate for families and could be enjoyed by anyone who loves music and art - and of course Broadway!  It is also cutting edge and captures the flavor of our fast-paced, loud, and ferocious city, something necessary for a production based on New York and Broadway culture.
WHY IS TOUR DE FIERCE EASY TO PRODUCE? The Broadway Dolls are a self contained act.  As opposed to traditional musicals that require leading roles that sing and act, with an ensemble of dancers in the background, the Dolls are always front and center.  Five actresses that do it all.  Though down the line we would like to integrate more spectacle and visual theatricality, we pride ourselves on being an act that keeps talent and great material as the true star of our show. 

PRODUCTION COSTS

Staff and Fees:   $8,550.00         

AEA Salaries:  $7,182.06

Festival Fees:  $7,295.00         

Rehearsal Expenses:  $5,311.00

Administrative Fees:  $2,400.00         

Physical Production:  $5,300.00
   

 Help Us Get the word out!  Post a link to your Social Network of choice, and email to your friends and family!!!
We're on Facebook!      We're on Twitter!      We're on YouTube!


www.TheBroadwayDolls.com


 https://www.nymf.org/donatetotourdefierce

story:
â€œBoth the theatre and I have a great passion for the work of Eugene Oâ€™Neill so Iâ€™m delighted we are able to present these three rarely seen gems from Americaâ€™s greatest playwright." Kevin Spaceyâ€¨â€¨

 

Our Production of Eugene O'Neill's The Sea Plays at The Old Vic Tunnels

We need your help to continue funding our production of these powerful and poignant early works by Americaâ€™s greatest playwright.  With your help the atmospheric depths of The Old Vic Tunnels will play host to Eugene Oâ€™Neillâ€™s rarely seen classic trio of sea plays; an inspired marriage of setting and scene.  

About Us

We are a group of talented and creative theatre lovers who desperately want this production to go ahead.  

 

The production is being led by our talented Director Kenneth Hoyt.

Kenneth was a long time student of Uta Hagen at HB Studios and graduated from NYU's Tisch School of the Arts.  He founded the Provincetown Repertory Theatre where he served as Artistic Director for ten years. Regionally and at the REP his directing credits include Orpheus Descending, The Tempest, That Said in Jest/ An evening of new shorts by Craig Lucas, The Hairy Ape, and Zelda, Scott, and Ernest starring Norman Mailer and George Plimpton.  He worked at San Diego's Old Globe Theatre as Assistant Director to Jack O'Brien and Mark Lamos and was influential in the campaign to build a new theatre for Provincetown that successfully opened in 2003.  Last year Kenneth directed the UK premiere of Horton Foot's The Trip to Bountiful at London's Courtyard Theatre.

 

Within the production team are the designer Van Santvoord, the lighting designer Emma Chapman, the sound and music designer Alex Baranowski and the costume designer Spyros Koscinas. 

 

Our designer, Van Santvoord has worked extensively in regional theatre and off-Broadway.  He has recently worked Terra Incognita written and directed by Maria Irene Fornes and O'Neill 80 directed by Jose Quintero.  Further information on him can be found at 

http://drama.tisch.nyu.edu/object/SantvoordV.html.

 

Our lighting designer Emma Chapman trained at Bristol Old Vic Theatre School where she was the winner of the Douglas Morris Award for Touring.  She has worked with directors who include David Thacker, Alistair McGowan, Alecky Blythe and Matthew Dunster.  Further information on her can be found at http://web.me.com/emchapman/Emma_Chapman/Home.html.

 

Our sound and music designer Alex Baranowski has recently worked with Underworld and Danny Boyle on Frankenstein at the National Theatre amongst other prestigious productions.  More information on him can be found at http://alexbaranowski.co.uk/category/music-associate/.

 

The cast blends some of London's most established actors with a vibrant group of talented up and coming stage artists including Jordan Bernarde, Matthew Thomas, Matthew Travannion, Carsten Hayes, Kristian Phillips, Mark Carter, Gareth Kieran Jones, Chris O'Shea, Raymond Sage, Michael Norledge, Eddie Webber, Eva Traynor, Amanda Boxer and Vincent Santvoord.  

 

About The Sea Plays by Eugene O'Neill

 

This production will take place amongst the sweaty, industrial claustrophobia of the merchant ship SS Glencairn where the audience will experience the realities, complexities and camaraderie of a life lived at sea in the early 20th century.  Oâ€™Neill himself spent several years at sea and this came to be a prominent theme in many of his plays with a setting that reflected the ships on which he worked. These were the plays that introduced his genius to the world.

 

We hope to complete the Oâ€™Neill experience with our production of The Sea Plays following recent successful productions of The Iceman Cometh, A Moon for the Misbegotten (both starring Kevin Spacey), Anna Christie and the forthcoming Long Dayâ€™s Journey Into Night.   

 

See http://oldvictunnels.com/event/the-sea-plays/ for more information and to buy tickets. 

 

How you can help

With your help we can fully realise the potential of these powerful plays in the settings that they deserve.   

 

We have a short amount of time to raise the funds we need.  With rehearsals well under way, this play promises to be an exciting and immersive theatrical experience with your help.  The plays have already sparked an interest in the London theatrical community and ticket sales are brisk. However due to financial setbacks we require your support to bridge the amounts necessary between ticket sale potential and actual production costs. 

 

With an ambitious production team and large talented cast we need all the help we can get to continue with our set design, lighting design, costume design and the rental of equipment.  We want to be able to support the production team and the cast financially as well as stunning the audience with the quality of our design.

Without your help this production will struggle to continue.
