story:
We are Theatrica Ludos and this is our first London Fringe production (at The Greenwood Theatre, London Bridge). Rather than play it safe we've gone for something ambitious and a little dangerous. We have come together from various backgrounds in film, TV and theatre to create an original story.

"The Shadow Formula" is a noir thriller set in London, 1938, with a cast of 18 characters, 20 scenes, choreographed fights and daring escapes that are so action-packed, even the audience might not be safe!

The Plot

Washed-up veteran of The Great War, Cary Donat is content to ignore the gathering storm in Europe and drink himself into oblivion. However, when his fiancée Lily is callously murdered, he finds himself plunged into a deadly game of double-cross and espionage.

Hunted by the police and his enemies alike, Cary must clear his name, get his revenge, solve the mystery and save the world. His only allies are Raz, a beautiful rogue agent, and Claude, his old comrade from the trenches.

Together they must out-smart, out-fight and out-manoeuvre a ruthless gang of thugs, fascists and foreign spies, and destroy the monstrous Shadow Formula ... before it destroys the world.

"The Shadow Formula" is entertaining, fast-paced and intelligent, but also stylish, unconventional and surprising.

But why, you ask? 

We really believe that "The Shadow Formula" is fresh and fun with a good dose of mystery and excitement thrown in. It takes itself seriously when dealing with convoluted plots about spies and mad scientists and is being produced for the sake of a good yarn and nothing more: we aim to thrill and amuse the audience in equal measure.

Our ambition comes at a price. The show is being produced with a lot of hard work, commitment and, indeed, love: but they can only go so far. We need your help to make it the best it can be. Your donations will help to pay our essential costs and keep our ticket prices affordable, making sure it's a show that's accessible to the widest possible audience.

Without "The Shadow Formula" the world will be a greyer place (but, sadly, not like a stylish black and white film!)

Where does the money go?

Every penny of the cash raised here will go towards production costs such as set construction, transport, props, costumes and everything else we need to make the show 100% awesome. We're trying to be clever about how we do things and being on a tight budget certainly encourages creativity: but there are some things, especially some of the vintage stuff, that we just have to get right. Your investment can help us to bring this production to its full potential.

Finally

We're not just excited about getting your money: we're excited that people want to be a part of this. We’re even more excited that people want to come and see it so, whatever you do, tell a friend, spread the word and come see the show.

We hope you'll be as excited about "The Shadow Formula" as we are!

story:
Who We Are

BCRF arose from a desire to provide an opportunity for talented performers and artisans to showcase their skills and entertain the public in an historically themed setting. We strive to provide entertainment combined with education to all ages in a safe space producing an encompasing experience.

Bringing world history to life in the comforts of the modern age. 

http://www.bcrenfest.com
http://www.youtube.com/bcrenfest

Renaissance Festivals all over North America continue to provide multiple stages for unique historically and myth based influenced performances, vendor/shop opportunities for history and myth inspired products and performance developing improv and scripted challenges for their own storyline and villagers casts.

A select few of the many who are presently with us. 

*Martin - Villager/property manager: Props and sets have been his profession since 1990 and this is an extension of that.
*Chrisitina - Captain Charity/Co Fight Coordinator etc.: Performing for roughly 35 years, she puts her experiences in front of and behind the scenes to full use with all that she accomplishes on this.
*Ed - Cobbs Merrin and Co Fight Coordinator: Actor, graphic deisgner, artist. Having consistent long time fighters provide a more impressive performance. Also creates our Christmas cards.
*Joshua - Young John and youngest member of cast: This 11 year old actor is smart, curious and talented. For a character that was originally written for one year he insists on coming back.
*Julia - Queen Catherine: This talented piano teacher, dedicated actor is developing interest in production management.
*Amethyst - Costumer and villager: Straight out of fashion design this project provides her with more creative expression and an opportunity to not be limited to the restricting body types of fashion.
*Chilam - Sheriff: Artist and actor. Since his first day on this project he has found artistic expression through the character and the creation of our backdrops.

It takes roughly 50 to 150 volunteers, cast, command team, performers... etc... to make this event happen.  All of them with their own needs, ideals and goals that this project helps nourish.  

Why We Need Your Help

The finances to fund this project have come primarily from three different sources. The Co-Producers, ticket sales and vendor fees. Donations of materials and serivces have helped keep costs down and with a volunteer cast and crew, we have managed to continue the performance with less financial stress. However... Selling a new concept in BC has been a developing process that requires more than these sources can provide. We are barely surviving with a fraction of what we truly need in order to provide this product. Our ticket prices and vendor fees are smaller then they need to be in order to support growth, let alone maintain what we have. This project has become a second family and an entertainment opportunity that many have fallen in love with and now make it a wonderful part of their lives. Our goal is to pay off some of the back debt the producers have incured (mostly from interest on loans and start up costs) by raising enough money to help pay for 2013, leaving them some breather space to deal with back debt. Their belief in this project has had them contributing many times in order to keep prices more than reasonable for the performance the audience receives.

Where The Money Will Go

We will admit that our goal is smaller than our needs. We have chosen to focus on the BIG thing we know we cannot do without.

Property: We are presently looking for a new location in Langley (we will update if that is found before this campaign is done.). Based on past experiences property rental tends to cost us $2,000,00 to $4,000.00 for the one weekend. Some of the locations have charged us for set up and teardown days as well as additional fees, where as others just the weekend property use.

Just to give you an idea of our approx expenses (based roughly on department reports and receipts), PER year, and let you know where additional money will go if we make over the goal amount):

Entertainment related expenses including Jousters, stage needs, games and rides, etc. $15,000.00

Cast specific expenses including costumes, insurance, greenroom costs, props, first aid, etc. $10,000.00

Property needs (based on new needs on a new site) including seating, power, drinkable water, etc $3,000.00

If we can get the liquor laws changed back (Link for that petition is: http://chn.ge/TnA5QK ) the ‘pub’ costs us approx $3,000.00 to have.

Additional costs like security needs, ticket sales needs, advertising (flyers, webpage, etc), program books, webpage, etc. usually can cost us around: $10,000.00

This is all depending on how much we can reuse from year to year and how many trades, barters, donations of materials and such we can manage to acquire. The BC Renaissance Festival can cost us an additional $25,000.00 to $35,000.00 over the amount in the bank.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know alot of people are in similar situations or the same boats as we are. If that is your case and you are unable to contribute the amount you would like or unable to contribute at all, we will accept:

*Materials (costume, jewelry, paints, rope, wood, paper, cardstock, pens, markers, ID tags, pin backings, thread, cloth ribbon, buttons, feathers.. this is only a small portion of a LONGER list than this)
*Your time (General volunteers, security, games and rides, cast/villagers)
*Your artistic and business energy. Stage show and/or vendor. (Remember we are historically, worldly influenced, not controlled. Example: Plastic and modern interpretation is fine as long as it is history or fantasy/myth) Command Team and/or organiser.   
*Your promotional support (posting this campaign on your pages, helping us distribute flyers, putting up posters, coming to parades, etc.

The Impact

All over North America, with the appropriate support, Renaissance Festivals have increased Tourism and provided seasonal artistic jobs for many. They have also provided a safe unique space for stage shows performers, cultural presenters, hobby groups and and educational factions to present to the public their world and their talents. With The BC Renaissance Festival’s success story, we would, over time, have a permanent site ‘themepark’. With that we would be combining the much loved traits of the other North American renfests (bringing in tourism) with a taste of the talent here in BC to the renfest circuit (Giving regulars on the circuit the chance to see us shine). With that success that leads to a permanent site we will be in a position to switch long time dedicated volunteers to a paid (honourarium or per hour or percentage - depending) position, bring in performers on the circuit to add to our local talent base and with that create an even more viable entertainment and tourism product.
story_txt:
Who We Are
BCRF arose from a desire to provide an opportunity for talented performers and artisans to showcase their skills and entertain the public in an historically themed setting. We strive to provide entertainment combined with education to all ages in a safe space producing an encompasing experience.Bringing world history to life in the comforts of the modern age. 

http://www.bcrenfest.com

http://www.youtube.com/bcrenfest
Renaissance Festivals all over North America continue to provide multiple stages for unique historically and myth based influenced performances, vendor/shop opportunities for history and myth inspired products and performance developing improv and scripted challenges for their own storyline and villagers casts. A select few of the many who are presently with us. 
*Martin - Villager/property manager: Props and sets have been his profession since 1990 and this is an extension of that.*Chrisitina - Captain Charity/Co Fight Coordinator etc.: Performing for roughly 35 years, she puts her experiences in front of and behind the scenes to full use with all that she accomplishes on this.*Ed - Cobbs Merrin and Co Fight Coordinator: Actor, graphic deisgner, artist. Having consistent long time fighters provide a more impressive performance. Also creates our Christmas cards.*Joshua - Young John and youngest member of cast: This 11 year old actor is smart, curious and talented. For a character that was originally written for one year he insists on coming back.*Julia - Queen Catherine: This talented piano teacher, dedicated actor is developing interest in production management.*Amethyst - Costumer and villager: Straight out of fashion design this project provides her with more creative expression and an opportunity to not be limited to the restricting body types of fashion.*Chilam - Sheriff: Artist and actor. Since his first day on this project he has found artistic expression through the character and the creation of our backdrops.
It takes roughly 50 to 150 volunteers, cast, command team, performers... etc... to make this event happen.  All of them with their own needs, ideals and goals that this project helps nourish.  


Why We Need Your Help
The finances to fund this project have come primarily from three different sources. The Co-Producers, ticket sales and vendor fees. Donations of materials and serivces have helped keep costs down and with a volunteer cast and crew, we have managed to continue the performance with less financial stress. However... Selling a new concept in BC has been a developing process that requires more than these sources can provide. We are barely surviving with a fraction of what we truly need in order to provide this product. Our ticket prices and vendor fees are smaller then they need to be in order to support growth, let alone maintain what we have. This project has become a second family and an entertainment opportunity that many have fallen in love with and now make it a wonderful part of their lives. Our goal is to pay off some of the back debt the producers have incured (mostly from interest on loans and start up costs) by raising enough money to help pay for 2013, leaving them some breather space to deal with back debt. Their belief in this project has had them contributing many times in order to keep prices more than reasonable for the performance the audience receives.



Where The Money Will Go
We will admit that our goal is smaller than our needs. We have chosen to focus on the BIG thing we know we cannot do without.
Property: We are presently looking for a new location in Langley (we will update if that is found before this campaign is done.). Based on past experiences property rental tends to cost us $2,000,00 to $4,000.00 for the one weekend. Some of the locations have charged us for set up and teardown days as well as additional fees, where as others just the weekend property use.
Just to give you an idea of our approx expenses (based roughly on department reports and receipts), PER year, and let you know where additional money will go if we make over the goal amount):
Entertainment related expenses including Jousters, stage needs, games and rides, etc. $15,000.00
Cast specific expenses including costumes, insurance, greenroom costs, props, first aid, etc. $10,000.00
Property needs (based on new needs on a new site) including seating, power, drinkable water, etc $3,000.00
If we can get the liquor laws changed back (Link for that petition is: http://chn.ge/TnA5QK ) the ‘pub’ costs us approx $3,000.00 to have.
Additional costs like security needs, ticket sales needs, advertising (flyers, webpage, etc), program books, webpage, etc. usually can cost us around: $10,000.00 This is all depending on how much we can reuse from year to year and how many trades, barters, donations of materials and such we can manage to acquire. The BC Renaissance Festival can cost us an additional $25,000.00 to $35,000.00 over the amount in the bank.


Other Ways You Can Help
We know alot of people are in similar situations or the same boats as we are. If that is your case and you are unable to contribute the amount you would like or unable to contribute at all, we will accept:
*Materials (costume, jewelry, paints, rope, wood, paper, cardstock, pens, markers, ID tags, pin backings, thread, cloth ribbon, buttons, feathers.. this is only a small portion of a LONGER list than this) *Your time (General volunteers, security, games and rides, cast/villagers) *Your artistic and business energy. Stage show and/or vendor. (Remember we are historically, worldly influenced, not controlled. Example: Plastic and modern interpretation is fine as long as it is history or fantasy/myth) Command Team and/or organiser.   *Your promotional support (posting this campaign on your pages, helping us distribute flyers, putting up posters, coming to parades, etc.


The Impact
All over North America, with the appropriate support, Renaissance Festivals have increased Tourism and provided seasonal artistic jobs for many. They have also provided a safe unique space for stage shows performers, cultural presenters, hobby groups and and educational factions to present to the public their world and their talents. With The BC Renaissance Festival’s success story, we would, over time, have a permanent site ‘themepark’. With that we would be combining the much loved traits of the other North American renfests (bringing in tourism) with a taste of the talent here in BC to the renfest circuit (Giving regulars on the circuit the chance to see us shine). With that success that leads to a permanent site we will be in a position to switch long time dedicated volunteers to a paid (honourarium or per hour or percentage - depending) position, bring in performers on the circuit to add to our local talent base and with that create an even more viable entertainment and tourism product.

story:
It is the night of their high-school graduation and Myst and Grouper, two bright, well-to-do teenagers, have driven to the local lovers leap for a private celebration. Myst is seventeen, and the daughter of a fading rock star of dubious morals; Grouper is also seventeen, and the son of an ambitious, self-important U.S. Senator. Myst is determined to deprive Grouper of his virginity, but he wants to wait until they are married and settled into domesticity. As they drink beer, smoke pot and engage in sharply amusing, yet disheartening, interplay, it becomes increasingly evident that they are very lost young souls whose ideals have been sadly eroded by the shoddy, self-centered example of their elders.

 

“A provocative and theatrically exciting examination of the prospects facing today's youth, in a world where traditional values have declined and humanity seems bent on self-destruction. "OUT OF GAS ON LOVERS LEAP is a perceptive, well-written work."—BackStage.

"…creates a tender bond between its wealthy misfits and the audience."

—NY Times.

"…theatrical imagination and flights of humor…" —The New Yorker. "…presents a compelling argument that today's times are forcing today's kids to put new twists in the old rituals."

—NY Post.

 

Cast:

Mikey Lipka playing Grouper
Carleigh Beverly playing Myst
 
Director:
Danka Scepanovic
 
Your donation will: 
Pay for the Performance Rights
Pay for the Venue
Pay for the rehearsal space
Pay for the set design and construction
Pay for media materials: Posters, photos, advertising, programs.
 
If we DO reach our goal before we open on July 14th, all ticket sales will go directly to the artists! Any amount will help us reach our goal.
 
DATES & VENUE:

July 15th to July 20th.

8pm Mon-Sat.

2pm Sat. Matinee

Sterling Studio Theatre
163 Sterling Rd. Toronto, Ontario Canada

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP US MAKE THE LEAP...

SHARE our campaign on your FACEBOOK and/or TWITTER pages

ENCOURAGE your friends to make a contribution.

SPREAD the word, tell everyone and anyone you know.

REACH OUT by email to any individuals and/or companies whom you think might be interested in sponsoring us, ask anyone you think might be interested in supporting artists in Toronto.

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/events/334860899975007/?fref=ts

story:
Hi!  I’m Nathan Coppens.  I’m an actor and musician.  I’ve always been a creative, imaginative person – I started playing piano when I was five and got bitten by the theatre bug a few years later.  (Also, I was eleven when “Ace Ventura: Pet Detective” came out, and I spent hours in my room impersonating Jim Carrey.  So there’s that.) This summer I’ll be participating in the One Yellow Rabbit Summer Lab in Calgary, Alberta.  More on that in a bit – let me just say for now that One Yellow Rabbit is one of the most reputable theatres in Canada, and they do really awesome stuff.

I have a BFA in Acting, and am a graduate of the Globe Theatre Conservatory Actor Training Program.  I've acted in over twenty productions in the last seven years, across western Canada.  However, I’ve yet to be able to completely make my living through acting.  The competition is tremendous.  I need to start creating my own work if I want to get noticed and have a more successful career.  This is where you and the One Yellow Rabbit Summer Lab come in. 

The Summer Lab is a three-week master class taking place this summer.  Its focus will be on theatre creation techniques.  At this workshop I will be learning from some of the top theatre practitioners in Canada, and will have the opportunity to learn more about creating my own pieces.  I will also be creating and presenting a short solo piece as part of the workshop.  The skills I’ll learn in the workshop will be invaluable as I proceed in my career.  The workshop will also give me the chance to work with a new theatre and to form connections with all the other participants, who will be coming from across the country.

 

WHAT THE MONEY WILL GO TO:

One Yellow Rabbit Summer Lab Tuition ……………. $1,650.00

All money I get from this campaign, up to $1,650.00, will go directly to tuition.  Any excess (please, please, please!) will go to helping me get my butt out to Calgary and live there for the three weeks.

 

PERKS:

You get to contribute to the development of some great theatre!  But other than that, I’ve come up with a couple, which you’ll see off to the side here.  However, I’m stuck for further ideas!  If you wish to contribute to my campaign but don’t see a perk you like, drop me a line at nathan_coppens@yahoo.ca and we’ll work something out.  You know what you want better than I do!

 

ALSO: Please, even if you aren't in a position to donate, let other people know about my campaign!  Thanks so much, everyone!

story:
Short Summary

The issue of elderly care is currently inescapable. Cuts, the privatisation of the NHS and the recent Francis enquiry have brought care into the spotlight and into the media.

Take Care is piece of verbatim theatre that makes the political personal, giving a voice to the carers of the elderly that usually go unheard. The results of the interviews that we conducted have resulted in a captivating piece, in turn both horrific and humane.

We hope that Take Care will encourage discussion on the issue of care and continue to force care into the public conscience. The production engages with the voices of carers and the truths that they have to tell - something that the media has either failed to do or simply not bothered. 

Thus, we need to make sure as many people can see this performance as possible. The money which you generously donate will go towards advertising,insurances, printing and venue at the Edinburgh Fringe. Any additional money will be used to help Take Care tour to many other venues. Please donate to this worthy cause, and if you are a carer of the elderly and would be willing to speak with us, we would be so pleased to talk to you. Thank you.

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to thank the University of Warwick Theatre Studies department for awarding us the Clive Barker for £600. This money will be used registering the show for £295, and the remaninging £305 shall be used on the venue.

  • £295 of the funds we raise will go on the venue.
  • £200-250 will go on the printing of flyers and posters.
  • £100-150 of funds raised will go to insuring the show.
  • We aim to raise £200 as a float, for any hidden or unexpected costs. We will update the programme when we become aware of these to make sure you are in the loop.

PERKS!!

  1. Donate £10 or more and you will recieve a thank you card created by the Ecoute team.
  2. Donate £15 or more and receive a thank you card and a poem crafted by the wonderful Ecoute team.
  3. Donate £30 or more and receive a completely unique hand drawn poster of Take Care created by our very talented Zoe from Ecoute theatre.
  4. Donate £35 or more and receive a personalised video thanking you for your donation, as well as photographs of the rehearsal process.
  5. Fancy being the subject of a song? Donate £25 or more and Ecoute will write, record and send their song to you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE HELP MAKE US KNOWN!

Follow us on twitter and retweet information.

Forward any information to people you think may be interested.

Use the indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

The Rock Of Abandon, by Stephen Blackburn.

When blacklisted dramatist Euripides turns detective to avenge the murder of a courtesan he once loved, his investigation hurls him into a head-on collision with blackmail, treason, and the charismatic general who has just beguiled Athens into launching an unnecessary war. 

We are Fierce Backbone -- A company of writers, actors, and directors in Los Angeles committed to the creation of new and startling work. 

After huge success with our company's record 7 shows at the Hollywood Fringe this past year, we are producing our first full production at the stunning Lillian Theater.

Equal parts Greek tragedy, film noir, and CSI:Ancient Athens, The Rock of Abandon represents everything we work for as a company. Written by member Stephen Blackburn and developed and honed within the group, this play is ready to take over Los Angeles and solidify the presence of this new company on the LA Theater scene.

What We Need & What You Get

We have been fundraising for some time now, but are just this little bit short of our goal for producing the show. We are in rehearsals, and already looking forward to Opening Night. Your contribution makes sure that all the artists working tirelessly on this show are paid in full and on time.

All levels of contribution are appreciated! Even $5 gets you a Facebook shout out. $250 gets you two tickets to the Gala Opening Night with Greek food, an open bar, and tons of fun. $500 gets you on our official sponsor board. Got a project or company you want to promote? We'll list it! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Some people just can’t contribute cash, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
  • Find us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/fiercebackbone OR http://www.facebook.com/RockOfAbandon
  • Follow us on Twitter: @fiercebackboner
  • Use the Indie GoGo share tools to spread the love!

Thank you in advance to all our kind supporters!

story:
Hello! My name is Micaela Gardner. I am a dancer, choreographer and director. I am from the Southwest & of Hispanic and Scottish descent. I live in Northern New Mexico, where one branch of my family has been for about 350 years. I choreograph site dance works for The New Mexico School for the Arts, as well as create my own works- rendered in live performance & video.

My background in dance is thorough and varied- I studied classically from ages 7 to 17, then absorbed myself with modern and folk forms, such as Butoh, Afro-Haitian and Release Technique. I began making my own dances at 18 & have worked often, but not exclusively, in a solo format since then. My work is described as combining the expressionistic tradition of ausdruckstanz, (German Expressionist Dance), with contemporary urban & modern dance- focused in form, story & musicality. I am particularly interested in site-specific works, unusual dance installations and dance film.

I am excited to be building a full-length, full-cast site work, destined for The Federal Plaza Park in Santa Fe. There will be 3 performances, September 20, 21 & 22, 2013-all free to the public! The piece, 'MindSight-The Federal Dances', features 8 dances & a cast of 15. These dances refer to the rich and tangled cultural history of this region & the site itself, with themes drawn from the Spanish Colonial, Native American and Anglo-American interface of traditions & endeavors peculiar to the area. Supported by the rich and lively compositions of Daniel Murphy, the work ranges from quiet solos to athletic full-cast romps. The dances are costumed rather uniformly & minimally & arranged often chorically to suggest an every-human kind of atmosphere. The narratives blend cultural, human perspectives with an interest in diffusing the racism & absolutism prevalent in any colonial story. The short video above shows an earlier, work-in-progress version of one of the piece's characters-representing a misty sort of time concept wherein past, present & future mingle in confluence-suggesting the impact of now on then & then on now... I believe deeply in making & presenting this work & enjoy a beautiful group of dancers & artists who feel committed to realizing it with me!

Your kind contributions will support dancers, as well as achieve rehearsal space, materials & compensation for our composer & videographer. With fiscal sponsorship provided by the New Mexico Dance Coalition, your donations are tax deductible! 

More specifically, your donations to this project will contribute to: our composer's fee-$2000; rental of audio equpiment that will project the score to the audience & dancers-costing $1000; Fee for the vidographer, who will create a full-length document of the work, is $1000; Material for costuming a cast of fifteen costing about $500; rental of weekly rehearsal space for 2 months costing $500; promotion & program printed materials-costing $500; and lastly, with the remaining $6500, very modest paymenst for our dancers, ranging from $200 to $600, depending on casting... All this comprising our over-all goal of $12,090, (after Indiegogo fees & NMSC fees).

Rewarding your kindness are the following & fahbulous PERKS!... Program mention! Hand-written letter & photograph from the director, me! DVD of the complete performance! Rehearsal invitation! Libations with the cast! Dinner with the director at Bistro 315 in the beautiful & ancient city of Santa Fe!!! 

If unable to meet the goal of $13,000, we will simply press on, cutting whatever corners available & seeking support elsewise. Every cent of your contributions will apply as outlayed above. The show MUST go on!

'MindSight-The Fedral Dances' is a public work, created and presented in an attitude of service that will enrich & enlighten our dance & arts community with its collectivity, urge to humanity & inclusivity! I am confident that with my zeal & hard work, (& the energies & talents of a wonderful team of artists), I can bring this luminous work to Santa Fe audiences!

Thank You for helping to make this happen!

Realizing that not everyone can contribute financially, we implore you to share our campaign with any & everyone! Please make use of the Indiegogo share tools herein! And thank you in advance for graciously doing so!

The short video above shows an earlier, work-in-progress version of one of the piece's characters-representing a misty sort of time concept wherein past, present & future mingle in confluence-suggesting the impact of now on then & then on now... I believe deeply in making & presenting this work & enjoy a beautiful group of dancers & artists who feel committed to realizing it with me!
Your kind contributions will support dancers, as well as achieve rehearsal space, materials & compensation for our composer & videographer. With fiscal sponsorship provided by the New Mexico Dance Coalition, your donations are tax deductible! 
More specifically, your donations to this project will contribute to: our composer's fee-$2000; rental of audio equpiment that will project the score to the audience & dancers-costing $1000; Fee for the vidographer, who will create a full-length document of the work, is $1000; Material for costuming a cast of fifteen costing about $500; rental of weekly rehearsal space for 2 months costing $500; promotion & program printed materials-costing $500; and lastly, with the remaining $6500, very modest paymenst for our dancers, ranging from $200 to $600, depending on casting... All this comprising our over-all goal of $12,090, (after Indiegogo fees & NMSC fees).
Rewarding your kindness are the following & fahbulous PERKS!... Program mention! Hand-written letter & photograph from the director, me! DVD of the complete performance! Rehearsal invitation! Libations with the cast! Dinner with the director at Bistro 315 in the beautiful & ancient city of Santa Fe!!! 


If unable to meet the goal of $13,000, we will simply press on, cutting whatever corners available & seeking support elsewise. Every cent of your contributions will apply as outlayed above. The show MUST go on!


'MindSight-The Fedral Dances' is a public work, created and presented in an attitude of service that will enrich & enlighten our dance & arts community with its collectivity, urge to humanity & inclusivity! I am confident that with my zeal & hard work, (& the energies & talents of a wonderful team of artists), I can bring this luminous work to Santa Fe audiences!
Thank You for helping to make this happen!


Realizing that not everyone can contribute financially, we implore you to share our campaign with any & everyone! Please make use of the Indiegogo share tools herein! And thank you in advance for graciously doing so!

story:
DANCING MONKEY LABORATORIES along with Germany's Interdisciplinary Kolleg 'Karl Nimeni': Nature and Culture of the Night.

Presents a workshop production of:

KARL NIMENI IS NOT DEAD – I KILLED KARL NIMENI by Mike Czuba

April 16th to the 20th - 2013, at EPCOR CENTRE’s Motel space. 

Writer/Director: Mike Czuba
Choreography/Dancer: Melissa Tuplin
Original Music by: Nathaniel Schmidt
Featuring: Amy Sawka and Edward Ogum
Design by: Leon Schwesinger
Video editing by: Emma Casey

Part surrealist, part Kafka, part existentialist, continuing the theatrical tradition of Alfred Jarry’s pataphysics, but mostly this play is influenced and structured based on the teachings and research of Karl Nimeni.

Charles Fleming is in crisis; nothing makes sense or allows him to follow the flow of existence. Being is becoming difficult. We meet him in a jail cell, charged with the murder of Karl Nimeni. The only evidence against him is a dream.

Charles tells his story, not all of it, but how he ended up in jail. On this nocturlogical journey we meet different versions of Karl Nimeni as understood by Charles, a man he might have never met, and a Dancer who represents a primitive longing in Charles, beyond rationality and logic.

Through dialogue, movement, sound and projection we learn who Charles Fleming truly is, we discover the teachings of Karl Nimeni and we (whoever we are) leave the theatre with more questions then when we arrived.

KARL NIMENI IS NOT DEAD – I KILLED KARL NIMENI is a night play, a theatrical poem, a moment in time and a narrative dream. It is a play that is more than it seems and less than is known.

Founded in the Summer of 2012, the Nimeni-Kolleg includes 8 core members but is open for collaboration with other scientists, artists and collectives. Thus far, the Nimeni-Kolleg has worked with Theater Erlangen, Domfestspiele Bad Gandersheim and Arena… of the young arts. Intrigued by the night as a transitory medium, the Nimeni-Kolleg works inter-disciplinarily between Arts and Sciences towards its further exploration. 

**Karl Nimeni is a pioneer and an absent mentor for everyone who goes on to explore the night, dreams and the Unclear in his/her own way, between art and science. 

What your donations will go to:

All the money raised in this campaign will be split between the design of the show, including set pieces, costume and projections, as well as honorariums for our participating artists. 

As this is a workshop we are looking to experient with unique lighting and staging. 

What you will get:

If you are in Calgary, or might be visiting during the run of the show, a 20$ donation will get you two tickets to the show!!

story:
The international theatre company Hotel Pro Forma has been enthralling audiences all over the world for over 25 years with their unique mix of visual arts, architecture and music theatre. Now, with your help, audiences in the United States will for the first time be able to see the award-winning performance, WAR SUM UP, at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on 1 and 2 November 2013 as a part of the 31st annual Next Wave Festival. 

The performance brings together Manga-artwork, the Japanese Noh-theatre tradition, and the powerful voices of the Latvian Radio Choir, who perform original music by British The Irrepressibles and Latvian Santa Ratniece, sung entirely in Japanese!

It is directed by Hotel Pro Forma’s artistic director Kirsten Dehlholm, who recently was awarded the highest accolade for a visual artist in Denmark, together with Olafur Eliasson. Her collaboration with light designer Jesper Kongshaug on WAR SUM UP ended in a Danish Tony Award for Best Set Design in 2011.

The performance has, since its premiere in September 2011 at the Latvian National Opera, toured to Norway, France, Denmark and Great Britain. This will be the North American premiere of the performance, and it will most likely be the only opportunity American audiences will have to see the show without travelling to Europe.  New York is of course the place that performing arts dreams are made of, so the opportunity to present there is not something we want to turn down!

The Brooklyn Academy of Musici has been very generous in handling the fees of the artists and crew involved, but funding of the travel for the cast and crew and the shipping of the set is still needed in order to make the performance a reality. This is where you come in.

Each pledge will go directly to plane tickets for the cast and crew to and from New York, or to the shipping of individual set items, such as our specialized LED lamps, or the newest HD projectors required to give the special depth-feeling created by the set’s two screens.

Our perks are designed to give you insight into the thoughts behind this and our other productions. They include personal skype calls with the artistic director, VIP tickets to the New York performance and backstage access to rehearsals and stage.

About WAR SUM UP – A Manga Opera on the Nature of War
- by artistic director Kirsten Dehlholm

War is as simple and as complicated as man itself. The nature of war is ever-changing, adapting to the era’s usable weapons and to the culture within which it takes place. War develops new technology, new strategies, new opinions.

WAR SUM UP tells the story and consequences of war through three main characters:

The Soldier is sent home from war. He suffers from PTSD (Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder) and he no longer feels at home in civilian society. He returns to the war and dies in an explosion. A monument is raised in his memory. His symptoms and fate exist today.

The Warrior is killed in battle. His unnatural death prevents his soul from a natural transition to the world on the other side. He becomes a spectre, a ghost, who must tell his story in order to find peace. An old superstition which still exists in many cultures.

The Spy is captured in the war. In order to be freed she must relearn her abilities in the martial arts and transform herself. She is transformed into a super-woman and escapes. She is a part of the fantasy-genre and popular culture.

All three stories are framed by the woman in yellow. She is the Gamemaster who begins the war. But she is also the person who perpetually continues working because everyday life must go on as a banality of evil even though there is a war. And she is the Gamemaster, who returns to start a new war.

Each story is intensified and enlarged when the voices of the Civilians are heard, as a large choir. Light and dark, colours and patterns in black and white together with manga drawings in XL format are other intense narrators. The space keeps the scene in a frame that opens up towards the rear at the end of the performance. The music and images drive the story forward while the words which are sung hit the story with the deep tone of poetry.

WAR SUM UP is inspired by Japanese culture and its powerful expressions of poetry, pop, precision and brutality. This is illustrated through the music, the song texts, the costumes and the universe of images. 
The libretto is created with texts from Noh-theatre, written by Japanese masters, which are sung in Japanese.

WAR SUM UP combines several musical expressions and styles. New composed classical music creates a spheric, electronic sound image. Newly written pop-music describes the three characters with a mix of chamber pop and electronica, where man and machine melt together. The old world meets with the new, when old texts unfold in the electronic universe in order to tell the never-ending story of the nature of war.

The Artistic Team

Vocals: Latvian Radio Choir
Conductor: Kaspars Putnins

Direction: Kirsten Dehlholm
Music: The Irrepressibles, Santa Ratniece with Gilbert Nouno
Concept: Kirsten Dehlholm, Willie Flindt
Costume Design: Henrik Vibskov
Libretto: Texts from classic Noh theatre edited by Willie Flindt
Light design: Jesper Kongshaug
Manga drawings: Hikaru Hayashi
Production: Hotel Pro Forma, Latvian National Opera 
Sung in Japanese with surtitles in English.

WAR SUM UP is co-produced by the Latvian Radio Choir, Latvian National Opera in cooperation with Ultima Contemporary Music Festival, Concert Hall Aarhus, Royal Danish Theatre, Odense Theatre and Hotel Pro Forma.

Hotel Pro Forma is supported by the Danish Arts Council's Committee for the Performing Arts. 

www.hotelproforma.dk

www.bam.org

story:
Who Marlieke Burghouts is:

Marlieke Burghouts is originally from the Netherlands. In New York City she teaches at the Hudson Valley Conservatory in Walden, NY. Her choreography has been shown at DUMBO dance festival, City Center Studio's, Triskelion Arts' Aldous Theatre, Studio 440, Dance New Amsterdam and Steps on Broadway. In fall of 2013, Marlieke will begin a Masters program in Choreography at the Trinity Laban Conservatoire of music and dance in London.

What we do:

Marlieke Burghouts and dancers is working towards their first evening length performance which will be held on June 1st at Center for Performance Research (CPR) in Brooklyn, NY. 

Plural bodies is a collaborative performance that exposes and questions the existing categories of gender and sexual identity. How much are we a product of society and how does the powerful western gender binary system understand and categorize an individual's identity? The three different works presented explore gender, sexuality and harassment against women. 

What we need from you:

I am starting this campaign to raise funds to cover the costs of the rehearsals and the theatre. The money you contribute will go towards the costs of rehearsal space, theatre rental, costumes and last but certainly not least paying the dancers a fair amount of money. The costs alone of rehearsal space and theatre space is $1300.

Because:

Many hours of rehearsals is a luxury and at the same time a necessity to develop and push the boundaries of our ideas and movements. We aim to develop a strong theatrical dance performance that exposes and discusses sociological concepts. 

- With your money I can get better costumes and music. 

- Last but certainly not least, I fnd it important to be able to pay the dancers. I am working with 6 talented dancers and they should get paid!

Every dollar is a step further for us!

story:
New Stretch Goal: $1000, aka the total out of pocket cost of the conference for me.

IRL (cash or checks donated in person) Donations To Date: $20

One Page Plays are SOLD OUT. Ten Minute Plays are SOLD OUT.

If you stil want a ten minute play, check out The Dictionary Deal REVISED

New Perks: The Dictionary Project Book ($15), The Dictionary Deal REVISED ($50) and 3 Page Garage Sale ($12)

Update Three in a nutshell:

There are only 24 hours to this campaign left, but I still have some plays to give out if I want to write a play a day until the conference! All remaining 3 page plays are half off, only $12 instead of $25.

Update Two in a nutshell:

We made it to the $500 goal! But the conference will actually cost me $1000. If the campaign reaches $1000, everyone that has donated up to that point will receive a copy of The Dictionary Project as an ebook at the end of the summer.

Update One in a nutshell:

If the campaign reaches its $500 goal, everyone that has donated up to that point gets a bonus 1 page play! If the campaign reaches its $1000 stretch goal, everyone that has donated to that point will receive a copy of The Dictionary Project as an ebook at the end of the summer.

Short Summary

Hello! My name is Cassandra Rose. I'm a Chicago based playwright, dramaturg, artistic director, and literary manager. In the past six years that I've lived in Chicago, I have worked with Chicago Dramatists, Victory Gardens, Redtwist Theatre, Steep Theatre, and Jackalope Theatre. I even started my own theatre company, Cold Basement Dramatics, which is dedicated to producing theatre about the things we hide from ourselves and others. Recently I was accepted into a pretty competitive program called the Kenyon Playwrights Conference, part of the Kenyon Summer Institute.  It is hosted by Kenyon College in Gambier, OH and will include lectures and seminars taught by theatre professionals from The Atlantic Theatre Company (New York), The Hampstead Theatre (London), and Steppenwolf Theatre (Chicago). For more information about the conference check out www.kenyoninstitute.org. I am thrilled and excited to be a part of the inaugural year of this gorgeous program, but I need your help to get me all the way there.

What I Need & What You Get

Think of this project as a merit-based scholarship. The Kenyon Playwrights Conference normally costs $2000. That cost includes housing, workshops, seminars, play readings, and all meals. Kenyon College has graciously granted me a $1000 scholarship based on financial need and my writing prowess. Unfortunately, while I love my day job, it does not provide the financial security to take a week off from work AND pull $1000 from savings. From the beginning of my application process I committed to paying at least the $500 deposit, and I stick by that assertion now. Therefore my goal of $500 is to cover the difference in tuition due and cash available. If I go over my $500 goal, wonderful! That's less I have to bankrupt myself in the process.

Basically, I want to write a ton of plays for a ton of people. You give me a random page in the Random House Webster's dictionary, and I write you a play based on one of the words from the page. THe length of you play depends on you donation.

Between April 5th and May 5th: 30 one page plays will be written.

Between May 6th and June 7th: up to 25 three page plays will be written on weekdays, and 5 ten minute plays will be written on weekends.

Between June 29th and July 28th: up to 5 bonus ten minute plays will be written on weekends.

What exactly could I write in one page? Here's an example from my full length play, At His Best:

 

ANN and BROGAN lay on the couch together. ANN is awake. BROGAN isn’t. When ANN is sure that BROGAN is still asleep, she slips smoothly away from him. She gets as far as the wedding dress hanging on the door to the bedroom. She touches the fabric but doesn’t feel it.

BROGAN
Are you still going to marry him?

ANN
Yes.

BROGAN
Are you sure?

ANN’s reply is in her hand against silk.

BROGAN (CONT’D)
Come back to me, Annie.

ANN
I should get ready.

BROGAN
Just one more time.

ANN
You should go.

BROGAN
Annie. . .

ANN
Please, Brogan. I don’t want to think about this anymore.

 

At the end of the summer all plays written will be given a once over and turned into a complete collection. You can reserve a paperback copy of that book through your donation.So what do you say? Check out the perk levels to your right for more info!

The Impact

With this Kenyon Playwrights Conference, I will be able to meet and work with playwrights, literary managers, and artistic directors from all across the country and the world. It's a week of not worrying about a day job, outside projects, housekeeping, or the hustle and bustle of Chicago. It's a week of pure theatre. And doesn't everybody deserve that at one point or another?

Additionally, The Dictionary Project will help me practice my writing at an accelerated pace in preperation for the big conference.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with friends and family through social media. Positive messages of support are alway welcome- they make me feel warm and fuzzy inside. And you can follow me on twitter @PlaysByRose. I'll be posting updates about the plays I'm writing on a daily basis. Check it out!

story:
Sponsor Music for PAE's Twelfth Night and help us "play on"!

This summer, July 21-September 3, Portland Actors Ensemble will be performing William Shakespeare's beautiful TWELFTH NIGHT or WHAT YOU WILL in parks all around the Portland metropolitan area. TWELFTH NIGHT features the most songs of any play Shakespeare wrote. Please support our composition of all original music for our upcoming production of TWELFTH NIGHT by sponsoring a song!

In exchange for sponsorship you receive: 

  • Acknowledgement in the program as the song's sponsor
  • A copy of the sheet music for the song, signed by the cast and crew
  • A recording of the song for you to cherish for years to come
 
Keep the tradition of artist sponsorship alive -- and give a great gift to your loved one! I mean, "if music be the food of love," what person doesn't want a song composed in their honor?
 
Each song is a unique original composition, so donate early to secure the one -- or two or three -- you love most!
 
Depending on the amount of your contribution, you can sponsor a little ditty like "There dwelt a man in Babylon" or the stunningly beautiful song, "O Mistress Mine" which poses the famous question, "What is love?"

All contributions are tax-deductible and will help us compensate our brilliant Twelfth Night composer and sound designer and allow for upkeep of instruments during the course of the run.

In addition to a financial donation, you can also donate your facebook and twitter status! Please help us spread the word: Tell your friends, like us and share this page! We look forward to seeing you at our performances this July 21-September 3. Check out www.portlandactors.org for a full schedule!

story:
Who are we?

Well that's an easy one! We're Distilled Theatre Company!  Founded in January of 2012 by two NYU Educational Theatre graduates, Lisha Brown and Liz Regan, Distilled Theatre strives to produce high quality and innovative theater that breathes life into original works. While staying true to the vision of the playwright, our work focuses on new plays that are accessible to all theater goers and generate thought-provoking dialogue.

Liz and Lishapartnered to provide a space and an opporunity for new plays to flourish. Through our training and countless years of theatre experience, we became throroughly interested in the process of developing new work. We believe creating new work allows all artists involved to use their imagination as well as take risks that further their talents.  It challenges all sides of the creative process to produce something great that has never been done before.

Our company means everything to us.  It is our passion and we work hard every day to see it become a reality.  We are starting from nothing in the hopes that hard work, dedication, passion and willingness to collaborate will kick off the first of many enthralling and mindful new theatre pieces.  

The Production

Raul Curry has been the captain of the Rubicon, a small fishing ship that docks in Calumet Harbor off Lake Michigan, for 15 years. When a fish, foreign to the waters, starts eating all the game in the lake, Raul and his crew take it upon themselves to make sure no more of the invasive fish get into their territory. What could have been a simple mission ends in murder as years of mistrust and repressed anger unravel on one fateful night that will forever change not only the fishermen’s lives, but also the lives of the families they leave behind. 

Ahoy, Abel Brown! explores themes of fate and the mysterious and deep attraction people feel toward the sea.  The brotherhood of the crew is put to the test when providing for themselves and their family becomes do - or die.  Tyler was inspired to write this play when he discovered the very real problem of the Asian Carp invading the lake and throwing off the balance of the ecosystem.  Additionally inspired by shows such as Deadliest Catch, Tyler wanted to explore what would happen to the community who's method of livelihood had been altered by the Asian Carp, as well as how the dynamic between the characters would change if new characters invaded their established lives. 

Tyler Grimes is a writer/actor/educator/bush league space explorer, and recent graduate of New York University with a degree in Educational Theatre. His full-length horror play Transylvania Beach, Kentucky was recently published and is available for purchase on indietheaternow.com. His short play Meat. was a finalist for the 2011 Heideman Award from the Actor's Theatre of Louisville. Selected plays written and performed include eternalism, Play Pretend, Hazel Green & The Mystery at Grendel Lair, the Pockets and Thud plays, and The GraveRobbers. 

 This production will run at the Producer's Club, for October 25-28th. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have recieved tremendous moral support and entusiam, and our first event, "Playoffs - A Night of Readings" was a huge success.  But in order to bring Ahoy, Abel Brown to a theatre near you, we need monetary support.  Your donation is crucial in covering the expenses of providing this unique work to an audience.  

We are capable of creating beautiful and compelling theatre - a show you will not forget - but we need to pay rent! Our goal is $3,000 and every little penny counts! This covers everything from rehearsal studio rentals to programs.  Everything goes directly into this production of "Ahoy, Abel Brown!" 

This show will be performed at the Producers Club near Times Square. The rental for the theatre space alone is almost $2,300! We need your help to make rent!  

What it takes to put on a show!

$2300 - Theatre rental

$400 - script printing (workshopping requires new pages every day!), programs and posters

$500 - rehearsal spaces

$300 - costumes, sets, props

 Our perks are fantastic because in addition to the material bonuses you get, you also recieved Liz and Lisha's undying gratitude. Being able to do this show successfully is a dream come true.  We know you have a choice in what projects you fund and we promise you won't be disappointed with this show. 

The Impact

This is just the beginning for Distilled Theatre Company. This start up money will allow us to start on a great journey that will support many budding playwrights.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, that's ok, we understand! You can still help us out by volunteering (we have lots of opportunities!) and donating space, materials, props, anything that might be helpful in cutting costs. 

 

*And last but not least - be sure to tell your friends about us and COME SEE THE SHOW!

story:
ABOUT US:

 We are a group of high school and college students from the Bay Area excited to explore theatre for social change.  This summer we will be producing several creative theatre events; including the play R.U.R.by Karel Capek. We hope to cover the cost of our events through donations and will donate any proceeds to our nonprofit sponsors in the local community. 

Mountaintop Company Productions is an entirely student run organization. That being said, none of the students will be getting paid anything for their time here. We work because we love what we do, and we want to learn to make the world a better place through our art.

We are reaching out to those who are passionate about theatre for social change and asking you to give whatever you can to help make our dream a reality.

What We Need & What You Get

THE BREAKDOWN:

 

SET: $300-350

  • This will pay for paint, lumber and hardware.

COSTUMES: $200

  •  We are hoping to get most of the costumes donated; however certain items - like lab coats - will cost us some money.

PROPS: $320

  • The script requires some lab equipment, stage-ready revolvers, and a mannequin, along with other "set dressing" items.  

MARKETING: $500

  • This will help ensure we sell out the performances and that the hard work of all the students in our company is well publicized. This money will also cover the cost of limited promotional materials, e.g. cast t-shirts.

OVERHEAD: $400

  • This includes food to keep the tired actors/technicians from passing out before performances, as well as some limited office materials including paper  and ink for printing scripts.

 

The Impact

We are hoping to expose more people to the ways in which theatre can be used for social change. These funds will allow us to put on a quality production that engages the community and benefits both the audience and the artists as they explore theatre for social change together. Student productions allow the students involved to feel empowered and important, and your funding will allow these students to feel that their involvement in MCP was a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the means to donate, we would still appreciate your support! Please take advantage of indieagogo's sharing tools and spread the word as much as possible. The more people you can tell about Mountaintop Company Productions, the better!

story:
Short Summary

I have a dream. For as along as I can remember, I have been writing, and this year, in my senior year of college, I have an amazing opportunity to see my words come to life on stage for the first time. I have been lucky enough to find a very talented director and producer who believe in my vision, and with the great platform of the Hollywood Fringe Festival, there is only one thing that stands between me and this dream. And that’s where you come in.

I need your help to help me make the transition from young aspiring playwright to produced playwright. To anyone who knows me, to anyone who has a dream and needed a little help to get it, to anyone who believes in the truth art can provide, I ask that you do whatever you can.

I will be forever grateful for not just the financial support, but what that financial support means. That you believed in me when no one else did, at a time when less than 17% of productions are written by women. That you believed in this 20-year-old dreamer, and you were the help that made her dream come true.

 

What We Need & Where It's Going

Here is a copy of our actual budget:

Theater rental (rehearsal/performance) - $2100

Admin Costs (printing, payroll, misc.)- $550

Publicity - $500

Costumes - $ 400

Registration Fee - $250

Sets and Props - $250

Sound Design - $50

 

TOTAL = $4100

 

The Impact

The Hollywood Fringe is the first step towards my goal: an off Broadway run.

Whether you can donate a dollar or a thousand dollars, your sponsorship of this work is absolutely vital to the lifeblood of the production.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word!

If you may know of anyone who likes to support the arts, or lives in Los Angeles and would perhaps want to see a play and help encourage young creative voices in theater... pass it along!

story:
Who are The Portland Players?

We are Maine’s oldest non-profit community theater, now in our 82nd season. Our mission is to provide Southern Maine with a high-quality, educational, and fun theater experience that is accessible to everyone.

We produce three musicals, two straight plays, and an assortment of children’s programs, workshops, and special events every year.

Why we need your help.

Right now, the theater's primary source of revenue comes from ticket sales. We are thrilled that our patrons are as passionate about our mission as we are, and we don’t want to burden them with higher ticket prices. However, our aging building is in desperate need of a new furnace, a new roof, and significant interior and exterior updates.

Ticket sales have been enough to cover the cost of our season, but in order to keep our shows affordable and address the serious repairs our building needs, we need to drastically increase the financial support network of our theater.

We feel the best way to do this is to start an Annual Appeal, however, at this time we simply don’t have the wiggle room in our budget to foot the upfront costs, such as printing and postage.

When will the Annual Campaign take place?

Our Annual Appeal will be in the mail by December 1st for end-of-year donations.

Revenue from our Annual Appeal will not only go toward the repair of the building, but will ensure the continuation of this historic theater organization.

What can you do if you can't donate?

Help us spread the word!  Link to this campaign on your Facebook and Twitter, email your friends and family to tell them why we are raising money.  We can only reach so many people, but when we add your network to ours, the possibilities are endless!

If you want to get involved around the theater, The Portland Players is always in need of enthusiastic volunteers. You can get in touch with us on our website at http://www.portlandplayers.org/volunteer and we’ll put you to work straight away!

story:
Dear Digital Friends and On-line Patrons,

Mocean Dance is stretching our collaborative reach and ready to shake the dance floor. I am pleased to share with you the development of our exciting new fundraising event Reverb.  With your support, you can help make this one-night only celebration come to life!

Taking contemporary dance out of the frame of the theatre and directly to the street, we want to share the power of the collective beat with the people of Halifax. See dance unfold right in front of you, spill on the walls around you and..... feel it inside you. This is Reverb, this is the power of dance! 

 

In celebration of International Dance Day, April 26 has been designated by the Canadian Dance Assembly as "dance empowers Canadian youth" day!  What better way to embrace the power of dance and the collective beat then by throwing Reverb, an intermedia dance party?  A super awesome event with guest DJ, internationally acclaimed Juno-award nominated DJ Adham Shaikh, and by creating two very exciting new-media installations with up and coming intermedia artists from Nova Scotia College of Art and Design.

 

Imagine a 'create your own sound score' interactive sound installation based on the body movements of the players in the room. Imagine a moveable sculpture with wi-fi cameras capturing the dancers, the room and the surrounding viewers into an immersive dance performance on screen and live in the flesh.  These are two ‘rocking’ new-media installations being created especially for Reverb by 4th year NSCAD students. 

 

Now, imagine a packed dance floor at Pacifco Dancebar moving to the collective beat, created by the electric global fusion sound of internationally acclaimed DJ Adham Shaikh. Imagine a room dancing together to celebrate contemporary dance, to celebrate Mocean Dance (Halifax's own BIG little dance company) and International Dance Day!

 

But to do this, we need your support.  Our digital on-line fans can make a difference too!

 

Your on-line support will go a long way, making the here and now a reason to celebrate....

Teleporting isn't quite available yet, and those Air Canada seat sales don't really count when you add the tax, so you may not be able to be here in person but your crowd-sourcing contributions can still make a big impact for Mocean Dance! 

 

Your support will go towards artists’ fees, the airfare for our special out of town guest DJ, and will contribute to Mocean's spring giving campaign.

 

I hope that I have intrigued enough to help give this great new media event the extra lift that it needs and that you will consider supporting Reverb and Mocean Dance.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about our event, the dance party not to be missed!
Reverb will be held April 26 at the Pacifico Dancebar, 9pm to 1am, 1505 Barrington St., Halifax, NS

Tickets are $15/adv, $20/door, $45/ VIP Mocean Patron. To Purchase ticket visit: www.moceandance.com

 

 

Celebrate International Dance Day in your own community, bring dance to life!

story:
Our Story

Beyond the Mountain is a non-profit Montreal based theatre company, our mission is to use methods of new technology as well as live performances to internationally disseminate works by Montreal artists. By touring emerging artists, the company aims to raise Montreal's cultural profile and aid its artists to create a larger impact on the international art scene.

Currently we are bringing Paul Van Dyck's critical acclaimed 'Paradise Lost', to the Atlantic Fringe in Halifax and to the Association of Performing Arts Presenters Conference in New York City.

Both productions will involve a lot of expenses such as venue fees, conference passes, lodging and travel.


Information on Paradise Lost:

This extraordinary production is a visual and technical treat replete with stunning CGI, spellbinding puppetry and first-rate storytelling


“How many one-man plays can boast impressive CGI, puppets and a bona fide script by John Milton?”

- Christopher Olson – The Link

"Montreal actor/director Paul Van Dyck has come up with a dazzling new solo performance art piece... that strikes with the force of devilish revelation ”

- Pat Donnelly - The Gazette

“Inspired… Intense… It’s great!”

- Jeanette Kelly – Homerun, CBC Radio


The Impact

We need your help to fund this amazing show's journey to Halifax and New York City. Paradise Lost's team will proudly be presenting what Montreal theatre has to offer in Halifax to the rest of Canada, and in New York to the rest of the world as the conference will receive delegates from around North America and the globe so please give generously to this cause and help show the world what amazing new pieces of theatre are coming out of Montreal


What We Need

Everything donated here will go towards paying for travel and lodgings in New York and Halifax, but first and foremost the money will go to paying for our venue fee the fringe in Halifax and our Conference passes in New york City.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please post this campaign to your facebook, tweet about it and generally spread it around to as many people as you can, Thank you!


Find us on the web:


Our official Website: http://www.beyondthemountain.ca/

On Twitter: https://twitter.com/#!/MountainBeyond

On Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Beyond-the-Mountain/222013214492808

Currently we are bringing Paul Van Dyck's
critical acclaimed 'Paradise Lost', to the 
Atlantic Fringe in Halifax and to the Association of Performing Arts 
Presenters Conference in New York City.


Both productions will involve a lot of expenses such as venue fees, conference passes, lodging and travel.
Information on Paradise Lost:
This extraordinary production is a visual and technical treat replete 
with stunning CGI, spellbinding puppetry and first-rate storytelling

“How
many one-man plays can boast impressive CGI, puppets and a bona fide
script by John Milton?”
- Christopher Olson – The Link




"Montreal
actor/director Paul Van Dyck has come up with a dazzling new solo
performance art piece... that strikes with the force of devilish
revelation ”
- Pat Donnelly - The Gazette
“Inspired…
Intense… It’s great!”
- Jeanette Kelly – Homerun, CBC Radio



The Impact





We need your help to fund this amazing show's journey to Halifax and New York City. Paradise Lost's team will proudly be presenting what Montreal theatre has to offer in Halifax to the rest of Canada, and in New York to the rest of the world as the conference will receive delegates from around North America and the globe so please give generously to this cause and help show the world what amazing new pieces of theatre are coming out of Montreal


What We Need
Everything donated here will go towards paying for travel and lodgings in New York and Halifax, but first and foremost the money will go to paying for our venue fee the fringe in Halifax and our Conference passes in New york City. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Please post this campaign to your facebook, tweet about it and generally spread it around to as many people as you can, Thank you!

 Find us on the web:

Our official Website: http://www.beyondthemountain.ca/
On Twitter: https://twitter.com/#!/MountainBeyond
On Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Beyond-the-Mountain/222013214492808

story:
About Me!

Hey there! I'm Rachael Weber (if you didn't already know). My birthday is around the corner and I'm using the opportunity to ask for your help! I've been hooping for two years now and can't seem to get the funds to purchase new gear. I am really hoping to pursue hooping a career path and eventually teach hoop dance to mentally and physically challenged people. Most jobs you get while being a hoop dancer require you to own an LED so you draw your audiences attention. Unfortunately I cannot purchase one myself and I can't raise funds to get one, unless I have one. Talk about a catch 22! That's where you come in. 

What I'd Like & How Much it Costs

Each dollar received will go towards props in this order:
  • LED Twin Hoops - roughly $100-$150
  • LED Mini Twin Hoops - $100-$150
  • Smart LED Hoop - $300-$400
Each donation received has it's own added perks!
  • Any donation up to $10 will get a shout out in the next video I make on my youtube channel (you can check that out here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCo3VZRHOetGR-enNfDgEccA)
  • Donations between $10-$25 will get to personally recommend ANY SONG of their choosing for me to hoop to! 
  • $25 to $50 will get a tutorial request where I'll make a video to ANY trick you've seen in my videos. 
  • Any donation above $50 will get a special ONE ON ONE SPIN/HANG session! If we can't meet in person due to distance, a skype session will be substituted. 
(Perks can be transferred to another person if requested by original donor) 


Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you don't have a buck to spare, doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Share this with everyone and anyone you know! 
  • And check out those nifty Indiegogo share tools!

Love you guys and thanks for helping me make my birthday wish come true!

story:
Hello, 

My name is Joe Costanza, I was born in Brooklyn, N.Y., I live in Los Angeles, and I am, among other things, a professional actor. I have appeared in over 70 television shows, made for TV movies, and feature films-- including Scrubs, Malcolm in the Middle, E.R., N.Y.P.D. Blue, Cheers, Criminal Behavior, Freaky Friday and Vampire in Brooklyn. I have done more than 20 National commercials including Nintendo, V-8Juice, Smart Beep, Snickers and the U.S. Postal Service. I have done stand up comedy, been a joke writer, and a warm up comic on Cheers, worked in casting, produced short films and I have worked as a voice over artist .But my greatest love is the theater.

I have performed in theaters from N.Y. to L.A., directed stage plays, taught acting and have written a play. It's called "ONE BIG HAPPY FAMILY".

"ONE BIG HAPPY FAMILY" is about a highly dysfunctional family: The Cavatelli's. Swimming along clueless in their dysfunction and struggling to deal with day to day challenges, they are all at once hit with a life altering event. "ONE BIG HAPPY FAMILY" is a play about escape, addiction, anger, love, fear and self loathing.  "ONE BIG HAPPY FAMILY" is a valentine to my strong, courageous mother and all strong courageous mothers out there who sacrifice their lives every day to help keep their families from falling apart.

I believe that "ONE BIG HAPPY FAMILY" is a play not just about my mother and my family: but it could be about everyone's mother and everyone's family. I believe it is universal with its rich cast of characters, familiar dialogue and recognizable themes.

What makes THEATER 4 A CAUSE so unique is that we will combine the joy of theater with the gift of giving. Half the proceeds from ALL ticket sales from EVERY performance will be donated to a worthy cause. Hence, THEATER 4 A CAUSE.  So, we are combining the passion of the theater with the passion of paying it forward. Please help us to make this a success.

As many of you know, I have been very fortunate to be successful in fundraising for many causes--- St Jude's, Los Angeles Children's Hospital, Stand Up 2 Cancer, ASPCA, The Actors fund, Equity Fights Aids, The Los Angeles Food Bank, Meals on Wheels, Hospice in the Home,  and especially for my "Into Action" groups. Now, as a member and Artistic Director of Theater 4 A Cause, I am bringing my fundraising talent to this fantastic Theater Company where I can continue my efforts of raising money and combining it with my greatest love---the theater.

Were hoping to raise $80,000 for this production. We can't do it alone so I am asking for your help. I am asking all of my friends to ask all of their friends to help make this campaign a success.

The money raised will go towards a production of "One Big Happy Family", theater rental, set creation,  materials, publicity, costumes, props, stipends for union actors and all other related production expenses.

If 80 of my friends on my Facebook page who love the theater ask 40 of their Facebook friends who love the theater and you can get them to donate just $25 (but please feel free to donate anything you'd like) we will reach our goal in no time. If you just give Theater 4 A Cause and ONE BIG HAPPY FAMILY just one hour of your time by personally contacting your friends, you will be doing this campaign a tremendous service.

Please take the time to check out this site.You will notice all of the fantastic and wonderful options available for your donation.

Spread the word and share the link to this project. Make phone calls, post it on your social media sites, call your friends personally and see what contributions they may be willing to make . With your help we could make this campaign a huge success!

We understand that times are hard for many people these days and extra funds may be difficult to come by. So, if you are unable to make a donation but would like to contribute in other ways please feel free to contact me and ask how you can help!

Theater 4 A Cause can only succeed with everyone's participation. So, let's make "One Big Happy Family" a great success! And through this production we can all help raise much needed funding that will go towards all these wonderful and worthy causes. Thank you!!

With love and respect,
Joe Costanza
