story:
INTRODUCTION:

Ignition Theatre, widely known for having presented some of
Central Alberta’s most provocative and rewarding live theatre is returning for the 2014/2015 season after a two-year hiatus.

“Two years go we made the decision to take a step back to reflect and refocus.  Having produced more than 40 productions in seven years and reeling from the unexpected closure of The Matchbox, we found that we were bailing water out of a sinking boat rather than simply paddling to shore to build a better, stronger boat.  In our time away we’ve entered into many discussions with past patrons and our peers to better cultivate our true identity.  We feel refreshed, energized and focused on producing the high caliber theatre for which we’ve become known and taking it to the next level.” – Matt Grue, Artistic Director, Ignition Theatre

Audiences will fondly remember Ignition Theatre for having presented some of the most memorable theatre in Central Alberta’s history including: Tuesdays with Morrie, The Drawer Boy, Deathtrap, Hedwig and the Angry Inch, It’s a Wonderful Life: The Live Radio Drama, My Name is Rachel Corrie and Bug among many others. Additionally, they presented several special productions including: Seth Rudestky’s Rhapsody in Seth, Deconstructing Broadway, Adam Pascal: In Concert, Miranda Sings! and Anthony Rapp: On Life, Love and the musical Rent.

YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP ENSURE LONG TERM SUSTAINABILITY AND PROVIDE US THE OPPORTUNITY TO MAINTAIN OUR HIGH STANDARDS AND, EVENTUALLY, BROADEN OUR PROGRAMMING.


THE IGNITION THEATRE 2014/2015 SEASON:

WORLD PREMIERE!

ORAL FIXATIONS

BY BLAINE NEWTON AND LESLIE GREENTREE
DIRECTED BY MATT GRUE
OCTOBER 9th THROUGH 18th, 2014


Food is love. Except when it's about competition, loss, cold comfort or revenge.

In this series of interconnected vignettes, Oral Fixations explores the ways we hide behind the culinary, using food to fill the gaps in our communication, be it parent to child, brother to sister or lover to lover.  Food is political. Food is emotional. Food is ridiculous. And sexual. So much so, you'll need to wash your hands afterward.

Join us for the feast.

“Ignition Theatre has had great success in presenting new work and we couldn’t be more thrilled to have the opportunity to bring to life the first play by the Newton/Greentree team.  They have captured, with biting wit and profound honesty, the emotional threads that bind us together by exploring our communal relationship with food. It’s hilarious, sometimes gut-wrenching and always insightful; Ignition Theatre is overjoyed to produce our fourth world premiere production” – Matt Grue, Artistic Director, Ignition Theatre

"Ignition Theatre is known for staging brave, intelligent plays, and we were delighted when they wanted to open their long-awaited re-launch with "Oral Fixations," says Greentree. "We think the play's quirkiness, darkness and humour are a great fit with the sort of complex plays they've always put on."


ONE OF THE GREATEST PLAYS IN MODERN HISTORY
A CO-PRODUCTION WITH PRIME STOCK THEATRE

THE GLASS MENAGERIE
BY TENNESSEE WILLIAMS
DIRECTED BY MATT GRUE
MARCH 12th THROUGH 21st, 2015


Amanda Wingfield is a Southern belle past her prime, living with two grown children in a small apartment in St. Louis. Amanda dreams of a better life for her shy and crippled daughter Laura, and so she pushes her son Tom to find a “gentleman caller” for the girl. However, the arrival of the gentleman caller sends shockwaves through the family and causes cracks to form in the delicate fantasies that have kept them going.

“In my opinion, The Glass Managerie is the greatest play in the modern cannon. It’s beautiful, poignant, heart-breaking and remains shockingly relevant today.  Williams has crafted a play with so much depth in one of the most strikingly poetic ways I have ever experienced as both a reader and viewer.” – Matt Grue, Artistic Director Ignition Theatre

“Prime Stock Theatre is excited to collaborate with Ignition Theatre to co-produce the Glass Menagerie, in the hopes of making live theatre more sustainable in Red Deer, and to bring Central Alberta audiences and artists a richer experience. This literary classic is completely relatable to today’s audiences and will be a great contribution to the local arts scene." - Patrick Beagan, President, Prime Stock Theatre

“We sincerely hope that this is the beginning of a long and prosperous relationship with Prime Stock Theatre and hope it lays the foundation for other companies to consider a similar concept. Being able to combine resources and experiences, we believe we can foster a new and exciting growth within the Central Alberta theatrical scene.”
– Matt Grue, Artistic Director, Ignition Theatre


What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will go directly into programming costs for the upcoming 2014/2015 season. It is very expensive to produce live theatre and often audiences or unaware of just how much goes into a production. Here are just a few examples:

Artist Contracts: $20,000.00+
Theatre Rental: $4500.00+
Printing: (Programs, Posters, Scripts): $1000.00+
Set Construction: $1000.00+
Props: $500.00+
Costumes: $500.00+

Our goal in the offset as much expense as possible through our box office - but we also depend on your generosity to help us maintain our high standards. Even a small contribution has huge impact, not just financially, but it demonstrates your commitment to live, professional theatre in Central Alberta.

We are offering several premium ticket packages available to you NOW rather than waiting until the official on sale date of September 1st. We also have lots f great sponsorship opportunities available for local business partners. Take a look and remember: everything helps. Everything.


The Impact

It is no secret that producing live entertainment, especially live theatre, in Red Deer has been a challenge. Our city is home to so many passionate artists just waiting for the opportunity to share their work with you. We've noticed a quite the decline is what is available for live entertainment options compared to where we were five years ago and we aim to change it. The feedback we've received is that YOU miss those opportunities. This is the time to contribute to brining it back full force. We can come back stronger and more prolific than ever and we can all share in that success. 

We were previously successful with an IndieGoGo campaign in which we raised money for the feature film adaptation of our hit musical "Year After Year". We stretched those dollars to their breaking point and were able to achieve the seemingly impossible. This is no different. We promise to make each and every dollar raised count.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute financially, there are MANY ways in which you can help. 

-Let people know about this campaign!
-'Like' us on Facebook or follow us on Twitter @ignitiontheatre.
-Spread the work about the upcoming season and encourage people to visit www.ignitiontheatre.ca
-Come see a show this season! And bring friend!
story_txt:
INTRODUCTION:

Ignition Theatre, widely known for having presented some of 
Central Alberta’s most provocative and rewarding live theatre is returning for
the 2014/2015 season after a two-year hiatus. 
“Two years go we made the decision to take a step back to
reflect and refocus.  Having produced
more than 40 productions in seven years and reeling from the unexpected closure
of The Matchbox, we found that we were bailing water out of a sinking boat
rather than simply paddling to shore to build a better, stronger boat.  In our time away we’ve entered into many
discussions with past patrons and our peers to better cultivate our true
identity.  We feel refreshed, energized
and focused on producing the high caliber theatre for which we’ve become known
and taking it to the next level.” – Matt Grue, Artistic Director, Ignition
Theatre
Audiences will fondly remember Ignition Theatre for having
presented some of the most memorable theatre in Central Alberta’s history
including: Tuesdays with Morrie, The
Drawer Boy, Deathtrap, Hedwig and the Angry Inch, It’s a Wonderful Life: The
Live Radio Drama, My Name is Rachel Corrie and Bug among many others. Additionally, they presented several special
productions including: Seth Rudestky’s
Rhapsody in Seth, Deconstructing Broadway, Adam Pascal: In Concert, Miranda
Sings! and Anthony Rapp: On Life,
Love and the musical Rent.
YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP ENSURE LONG TERM SUSTAINABILITY AND PROVIDE US THE OPPORTUNITY TO MAINTAIN OUR HIGH STANDARDS AND, EVENTUALLY, BROADEN OUR PROGRAMMING.
THE IGNITION THEATRE 2014/2015 SEASON:
WORLD PREMIERE!ORAL FIXATIONSBY BLAINE NEWTON AND LESLIE
GREENTREEDIRECTED BY MATT GRUEOCTOBER 9th THROUGH 18th, 2014
Food is love. Except
when it's about competition, loss, cold comfort or revenge.
In this series of
interconnected vignettes, Oral Fixations explores the ways we hide behind the
culinary, using food to fill the gaps in our communication, be it parent to
child, brother to sister or lover to lover. 
Food is political. Food is emotional. Food is ridiculous. And sexual. So
much so, you'll need to wash your hands afterward.
Join us for the
feast.
“Ignition Theatre has had great success in presenting new work and we couldn’t
be more thrilled to have the opportunity to bring to life the first play by the
Newton/Greentree team.  They have
captured, with biting wit and profound honesty, the emotional threads that bind
us together by exploring our communal relationship with food. It’s hilarious,
sometimes gut-wrenching and always insightful; Ignition Theatre is overjoyed to
produce our fourth world premiere production” – Matt Grue, Artistic Director,
Ignition Theatre"Ignition Theatre is known for staging brave, intelligent plays, and we
were delighted when they wanted to open their long-awaited re-launch with
"Oral Fixations," says Greentree. "We think the play's
quirkiness, darkness and humour are a great fit with the sort of complex plays
they've always put on."ONE OF THE GREATEST PLAYS IN MODERN HISTORYA CO-PRODUCTION WITH PRIME STOCK THEATRE
THE GLASS MENAGERIEBY TENNESSEE WILLIAMSDIRECTED BY MATT GRUEMARCH 12th THROUGH 21st, 2015
Amanda Wingfield is a Southern belle past her prime, living with two
grown children in a small apartment in St. Louis. Amanda dreams of a better
life for her shy and crippled daughter Laura, and so she pushes her son Tom to
find a “gentleman caller” for the girl. However, the arrival of the gentleman
caller sends shockwaves through the family and causes cracks to form in the
delicate fantasies that have kept them going.“In my opinion, The Glass Managerie is
the greatest play in the modern cannon. It’s beautiful, poignant,
heart-breaking and remains shockingly relevant today.  Williams has crafted a play with so much
depth in one of the most strikingly poetic ways I have ever experienced as both
a reader and viewer.” – Matt Grue, Artistic Director Ignition Theatre
“Prime Stock Theatre is excited to collaborate with Ignition Theatre to co-produce the Glass Menagerie, in the hopes of making live theatre more sustainable in Red Deer, and to bring Central Alberta audiences and artists a richer experience. This literary classic is completely relatable to today’s audiences and will be a great contribution to the local arts scene." - Patrick Beagan, President, Prime Stock Theatre
“We sincerely hope that this is the
beginning of a long and prosperous relationship with Prime Stock Theatre and
hope it lays the foundation for other companies to consider a similar concept.
Being able to combine resources and experiences, we believe we can foster a new
and exciting growth within the Central Alberta theatrical scene.” 
– Matt Grue, Artistic Director, Ignition Theatre
What We Need & What You GetYour contributions will go directly into programming costs for the upcoming 2014/2015 season. It is very expensive to produce live theatre and often audiences or unaware of just how much goes into a production. Here are just a few examples:Artist Contracts: $20,000.00+Theatre Rental: $4500.00+Printing: (Programs, Posters, Scripts): $1000.00+Set Construction: $1000.00+Props: $500.00+Costumes: $500.00+Our goal in the offset as much expense as possible through our box office - but we also depend on your generosity to help us maintain our high standards. Even a small contribution has huge impact, not just financially, but it demonstrates your commitment to live, professional theatre in Central Alberta.We are offering several premium ticket packages available to you NOW rather than waiting until the official on sale date of September 1st. We also have lots f great sponsorship opportunities available for local business partners. Take a look and remember: everything helps. Everything.The ImpactIt is no secret that producing live entertainment, especially live theatre, in Red Deer has been a challenge. Our city is home to so many passionate artists just waiting for the opportunity to share their work with you. We've noticed a quite the decline is what is available for live entertainment options compared to where we were five years ago and we aim to change it. The feedback we've received is that YOU miss those opportunities. This is the time to contribute to brining it back full force. We can come back stronger and more prolific than ever and we can all share in that success. We were previously successful with an IndieGoGo campaign in which we raised money for the feature film adaptation of our hit musical "Year After Year". We stretched those dollars to their breaking point and were able to achieve the seemingly impossible. This is no different. We promise to make each and every dollar raised count.Other Ways You Can HelpEven if you are unable to contribute financially, there are MANY ways in which you can help. -Let people know about this campaign!-'Like' us on Facebook or follow us on Twitter @ignitiontheatre.-Spread the work about the upcoming season and encourage people to visit www.ignitiontheatre.ca-Come see a show this season! And bring friend!

story:
MADBOOTS DANCE PREMIERES TWO WORKS THIS SUMMER AT JACOB'S PILLOW DANCE FESTIVAL 2015

FOR OUR JACOB’S PILLOW DEBUT, WE WILL PREMIERE TWO BRAND-NEW WORKS CREATED OVER THE PAST YEAR. OUR DANCERS, ROBBIE MOORE, DAN WALCZAK, AND CHUCK WILT, HAVE BEEN WORKING TIRELESSLY, AND WE'RE NOW IN THE FINAL STAGES OF DESIGN AND PRODUCTION. FOR THE NEXT TWO MONTHS WE'LL REHEARSE INTENSIVELY TO MAKE SURE EVERYTHING IS PERFECT.  THOUGH, WITHOUT SURPRISE, COVERING THE COST OF STUDIO RENTALS WILL BE A HEAVY EXPENSE. SPACE ISN'T CHEAP, ESPECIALLY IN NYC!

IN ADDITION TO THE PERFORMERS, WE'RE WORKING WITH A NEW TECHNICAL DIRECTOR, JENNIFER REISER (SHE’S BRILLIANT), WHO WILL BE DESIGNING ALL OF THE LIGHTING, AS WELL AS, STAGE MANAGING OUR PERFORMANCES. TO MAKE THE WORK LIVE AS VIBRANTLY AS POSSIBLE, WE NEED TO PURCHASE ADDITIONAL PRODUCTION ELEMENTS, SUCH AS: LIGHTING FIXTURES, A PROJECTOR, GELS, LOTS OF GAFF TAPE AND SET MATERIALS. WHO KNEW TAPE WAS SO EXPENSIVE?

AND FINALLY, WE CAN'T GO ON STAGE NAKED...WELL, NOT FOR THE ENTIRE SHOW ANYWAY...SO WE NEED TO COSTUME BOTH WORKS. PANTS, SHIRTS, SHOES, TIGHTS, BRIEFS, DANCE BELTS, HAND WRAPS, CUSTOM-MADE HEAD PIECES, AND KNEEPADS ARE ALL ON THE LIST. THAT'S FIVE OF EVERYTHING...YIKES.


THE BREAKDOWN:

  • PRODUCTION COSTS - $3,087.00

  • REHEARSAL SPACE - $1,168.00

  • COSTUME/ DESIGN - $974.00

PERFORMING AT JACOB’S PILLOW IS AN INCREDIBLE OPPORTUNITY, ESPECIALLY FOR SUCH A YOUNG COMPANY. PLEASE CONSIDER BEING A PART OF THIS EXCITING TIME FOR US AND HELP MAKE OUR DEBUT THE BEST IT CAN POSSIBLY BE.

ANY ADDITIONAL FUNDS RAISED WILL GO TOWARDS TOURING (SAD BOYS).  WE ARE HEADING NORTH TO TORONTO FOR THE INAUGURAL TOES FOR DANCE FESTIVAL THIS DECEMBER. CAN'T WAIT!


JACOB’S PILLOW DANCE FESTIVAL 2015

(SAD BOYS) | BEAU.

DORIS DUKE THEATRE

AUGUST 26TH - 30TH

TICKETS HERE

story:
Welcome to My World is a unique show - the first one-person musical ever written for and about a fourteen-year-old girl. This is the World Premiere of a brand new one-girl musical by Writer/Director Bruce Kimmel and we're very excited about it.  The show is a series of monologues and songs, taking you into the world of a bright, funny, iconoclastic young lady named Molly, who has her own very unique way of looking at things and life.  The songs are tuneful, witty and touching.   The response to the  first reading and then a staged workshop of "Welcome To My World" was extremely positive - the show got laughs, tears, and an instant standing ovation at the end.   
Bruce Kimmel has been working with Sami since she was twelve.  He has put her in his productions of his World-Premiere Anthony Newley/Leslie Bricusse musical revue, Pure Imagination (at the Pacific Resident Theatre), his acclaimed and rave-reviewed production of Li'l Abner, in his hit web series Outside The Box (seen exclusively on BroadwayWorld.com), and she's been a regular performer in his once-a-month Kritzerland shows at The Federal.  Sami has over 30 stage credits. 
Bruce got the idea for this show five years ago, when someone asked him if he could help them find a comic monologue for a young teen girl.  After searching for hours, he came up empty and just decided to write one himself, naming his teen girl Molly.  He began to think that a whole show of monologues with a young teen girl would make a really interesting show.  He put the idea aside for a while,  but early last year he began to look at it again, with an eye to developing it for Sami, who was now the perfect age for it.  For Sami, it was like a dream come true, something she's always wanted to do.  At that point it just began to morph from a monologues-only show into a full-length one-girl musical.
And now we're preparing for the full production, with sets, costumes, lighting and full-out staging and that's where you come in.    With your support, we can do a first-class production here in LA, help fund the cast recording, and even take the show to New York.    

This is the song "Annie" from Welcome To My World from the Kritzerland Cabaret.

 

   

Bruce Kimmel is a legendary Grammy-nominated producer of theatre music on CD, having produced over 180 albums.  He was nominated for a Grammy for producing the revival cast album of Hello, Dolly! and his album with jazz pianist Fred Hersch, I Never Told You, was also nominated for a Grammy.  He has produced solo albums for Petula Clark, Helen Reddy, Jason Graae, Liz Callaway, Christiane Noll, Rebecca Luker, Brent Barrett, Sally Mayes, Judy Kaye, Judy Kuhn, and many others.  His label, Kritzerland, issues soundtracks and theater music.  

For the past five years he has been producing and hosting a series of live entertainments based on the albums he’s produced, called Kritzerland at Sterling’s Upstairs at The Federal, which feature incredible singers and fun guest stars.  The shows occur on the first Sunday of every month at The Federal Nightclub in North Hollywood. His musical, The Brain From Planet X (written with David Wechter) has been seen in Los Angeles, New York, and the United Kingdom, and is now being performed regionally all over the country, including its first performance in French in Montreal. He is also the creator, writer, and director of the popular web series, Outside the Box.  His song “Simply” recently won the Mac Award for Best Song of the Year.  He recently directed rave-reviewed productions of the musicals Li’l Abner and Inside Out.

Mr. Kimmel wrote, directed and starred in the cult movie hit, The First Nudie Musical (available on a Special Edition Blu-ray).  He also co-created (with David Wechter) the story for the hit film, The Faculty, directed by Robert Rodriguez.

Mr. Kimmel is the author of fifteen books – his acclaimed Benjamin Kritzer trilogy (Benjamin Kritzer, Kritzerland, and Kritzer Time), the mysteries Writer’s Block and Rewind, his six Adriana Hofstetter mysteries (Murder At Hollywood High, Murder At the Grove, Murder At the Hollywood Historical Society, Murder At the Masquers, Murder at the School Musical, Murder at the Hollywood Division) his collection of short fiction, How To Write A Dirty Book and Other Stories, and two memoirs, “There’s Mel, There’s Woody, and There’s You”: My Life In The Slow Lane, and Album Produced By... More of my Rollercoaster Life.

As an actor, Mr. Kimmel guest-starred on most of the long-running television shows of the 1970s, including The Partridge Family (recurring), Happy Days, Laverne and Shirley, MASH, Alice, and many others, including leading roles in several pilots for all three of the major networks.

  


Sami, a millennium child,  has been performing on stage since she was 4, where it was love a first footlight! Sami's first professional gig was at the age of 8 and she hasn't stopped since. She LOVES musical theatre and has over 30 credits on stage. She is equally at home in front of the camera or in a recording studio singing and recording voice-over.  Sami has performed on stages all across the country from Los Angeles to New York. She is part of a very active cabaret scene performing in Los Angeles and in NYC alongside some of the great talents in musical theatre and cabaret today. Sami earned her Equity card at the age of 11 for the title role of Annie at the Pioneer Theatre Company.

Sami balances school with a professional acting and singing schedule, performing in cabarets around the country and also taking part in musical theatre productions, readings and workshops, TV/Film & Voiceover. All this and she competes on the Comedy Sportz LA High School Team. She's fortunate that she has a school that is supportive of her career and a loving family that is by her side. At school, as a part of her core curriculum she takes American Sign Language as her foreign language requirement and she's a natural. She even gets to sign in Welcome to My World!

In January, 2015, Sami was honored to be nominated for 3 Robby Awards for 3 different projects she worked on with Bruce Kimmel in 2014. The Robby Awards recognize the best theatre in Southern California - and there's a lot of great theatre on the West Coast!   www.samistaitman.com

Alby Potts, Musical Director. Los Angeles credits include Singin' In The Rain (Ovation Award winner) and Miss Saigon (Ovation nomination), Chicago musical directing credits include Into The Woods and Brigadoon (Jeff Award nominations). Alby has played keyboards for national tours of Book Of Mormon, Wizard of Oz, Evita, Wicked, Addams Family, West Side Story, White Christmas, Spamalot, and many LA area productions. Also a composer, Alby’s CD Dreaming For Real charted number one on independent radio stations. Alby’s song Joy, Hope, and Peace appeared on George Winston’s Grammy nominated album Montana-A Love Story. Film score credits include Season of Change, Frozen in Fear, Dance, Search For A Heavyweight Contender, and others. Alby graduated from the Boston Conservatory of Music and Northwestern University.

                  

  

Corey Fogelmanis plays Farkle on Disney's mega-hit show "Girl Meets World".  Corey has been involved with theatre from a very young age and this year Corey was honored to receive an Arts Advocate Award for his dedication for community theatre. Corey is a long-time friend of Sami's and he loves and supports musical theatre!   Matter of fact, Sami and Corey have been performing on stage together since they were in elementary school and they've also worked together on TV and in film. We're so happy that he and his amazing family are here to support this brand new one-girl musical and that he is recording one of the songs from the show for the Original Cast Recording.** (**EXCLUSIVE OFFER ONLY. ENDS 8/5)

We want to raise $16,500 for our World Premiere production.  Doing a show in Los Angeles isn't cheap, and the money raised will help pay for the theatre rental, rehearsal space, lighting, the set, costumes, insurance, and all the production expenses.   It will also help fund the Original Cast Album recording, which we plan on doing two weeks before the show opens so that we have the CD in time for our run.

We have tried to make the perks really fun.  You can get sheet music downloads, the cast album, and tickets to the show at a considerable savings! There's even a wonderful perk to our Opening Night Performance and the Reception that follows. For every donation, you can get your name in the thank you's on our website.  For a larger donation, in the program, you can become an Associate Producer with credit in the program or you can even become an Above-the-Title Producer!   You get something fun at every perk level and you will be a major part of realizing this dream.

Every cent of what we raise goes to the stage production and the recording of the cast album.  Bruce Kimmel is not taking a salary, nor is Sami - all money goes to the physical production, the CD, and if we get to our goal and even exceed this show is going to New York!

Sami in rehearsals with Director/Writer Bruce Kimmel before the Workshop. 

During our workshop presentation last month, our audience included a lot of young teens and the show really spoke to them.  One young lady said, "It was like seeing my life on stage."  The show will appeal to both kids and adults and can have a long and successful life if we achieve what we hope we'll achieve.  The show runs 85 minutes and is performed without an intermission.  At the workshop, this production received an instant and heartfelt standing ovation.
Bruce Kimmel has been a part of L.A. theatre for over forty-eight years and has a very successful track record as a writer and director.  His productions were nominated for twelve Robby Awards in 2014, and he is also the recent recipient of a Mac Award (the New York Cabaret Awards) for Best Song of 2014 for his song "Simply" and has been nominated for two Grammy Awards.  His recent production of Doug Haverty and Adryan Russ's musical Inside Out, received across the board raves and had a sold out run at the same theater where we'll be doing Welcome to My World.

We believe this musical will be a success, and we hope you'll come along on the journey.

Risks & Challenges

If there are risks, they are only in spreading the word and getting people into the theatre.  And we are all committed 1000% to doing that.  

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't be of help.  You can help us get the word out on Facebook, Twitter and other social media by sharing the campaign (easy to share right from this campaign page).  We just need to make everyone aware of our campaign and our show.

And that's all there is to it, so WELCOME TO OUR WORLD and THANK YOU for your help!

For every donation, you can get your name in the thank you's on our website.  For a larger donation, in the program, you can become an Associate Producer with credit in the program or you can even become an Above-the-Title Producer!   You get something fun at every perk level and you will be a major part of realizing this dream.
Every cent of what we raise goes to the stage production and the recording of the cast album.  Bruce Kimmel is not taking a salary, nor is Sami - all money goes to the physical production, the CD, and if we get to our goal and even exceed this show is going to New York!
    

Sami in rehearsals with Director/Writer Bruce Kimmel before the Workshop. 



During our workshop presentation last month, our audience included a lot of young teens and the show really spoke to them.  One young lady said, "It was like seeing my life on stage."  The show will appeal to both kids and adults and can have a long and successful life if we achieve what we hope we'll achieve.  The show runs 85 minutes and is performed without an intermission.  At the workshop, this production received an instant and heartfelt standing ovation.
Bruce Kimmel has been a part of L.A. theatre for over forty-eight years and has a very successful track record as a writer and director.  His productions were nominated for twelve Robby Awards in 2014, and he is also the recent recipient of a Mac Award (the New York Cabaret Awards) for Best Song of 2014 for his song "Simply" and has been nominated for two Grammy Awards.  His recent production of Doug Haverty and Adryan Russ's musical Inside Out, received across the board raves and had a sold out run at the same theater where we'll be doing Welcome to My World. We believe this musical will be a success, and we hope you'll come along on the journey.
    Risks & Challenges If there are risks, they are only in spreading the word and getting people into the theatre.  And we are all committed 1000% to doing that.  
    

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't be of help.  You can help us get the word out on Facebook, Twitter and other social media by sharing the campaign (easy to share right from this campaign page).  We just need to make everyone aware of our campaign and our show.
   And that's all there is to it, so WELCOME TO OUR WORLD and THANK YOU for your help!

story:
*ENGLISH BELOW*

-------

Lisez ce qui suit afin de mieux connaître la compagnie ainsi que ses projets de création. Aidez-nous à atteindre notre objectif et par le fait même, contribuez à l'expansion d'une forme de danse unique en son genre!

Votre soutien est important et facilitera grandement nos projets de création. Aucun montant n'est trop petit, n'hésitez pas à donner selon vos moyens.

 

Groupe RUBBERBANDance : qui sommes-nous?

Avec le Groupe RUBBERBANDance (RBDG), le chorégraphe Victor Quijada réconcilie les esthétiques des deux pôles de la danse qui l’habitent : la spontanéité, le risque, la témérité et l’audace de sa jeunesse, alors qu’il baignait dans la culture hip-hop, et le raffinement et la maturité chorégraphique du ballet et de la danse contemporaine, où il a évolué en tant que danseur professionnel.

Fondée à Montréal (Québec, Canada) en 2002, la compagnie a depuis produit 14 spectacles qui ont voyagé à travers le monde. Sa plus récente création, Vic's Mix, est actuellement en tournée au Québec, aux États-Unis et en Europe.

RBDG coproduit également cinq films chorégraphiés par Victor Quijada, dont trois où il assure la réalisation / coréalisation : Secret Service, Small Explosions That Are Yours to Keep et Gravity of Center. Au fil des années, plusieurs de ses courts-métrages sont primés sur les circuits des festivals à travers le monde.

 

À quoi serviront vos dons :

Deux projets de création innovateurs sont au programme pour la saison 2016-2017 . En participant à notre campagne, vous contribuerez à propulser la compagnie dans une nouvelle ère de création, en plus de faciliter son expansion.

Présentation des projets en cours

1) Résidence de création au Baryshnikov Arts Center

Cette résidence, obtenue grâce au prix Work in Progress Residency Award du Princess Grace Foundation USA, permettra au chorégraphe Victor Quijada, l’artiste en art visuel Sylvain Baumann et le compositeur Jasper Gahunia de créer une nouvelle œuvre au sein d'une institution à la fine pointe de la production scénique. L’artiste Sylvain Baumann a créé, pour l’occasion, une structure architecturale en métal. Celle-ci sera modifiée et manipulée, lors de la prestation, afin de prendre plusieurs formes. C’est un tout nouveau défi pour la compagnie : engendrer des mouvements au sein d’un espace architectural, d’un décor à la fois rigide et malléable.

Victor Quijada et ses collaborateurs seront en résidence au célèbre Baryshnikov Arts Center à New York en 2017. 2 500$ des 5 000$ récoltés lors de la campagne seront affectés à ce projet de résidence.

 

2) Spectacle in situ avec éléments technologiques

Imaginez-vous au cœur de la ville, dans un lieu qui n'est pas, à première vue, propice à une performance de danse. Sous vos yeux, les danseurs de RBDG prennent possession des lieux. Armé de votre téléphone intelligent et d'une application spécialement conçue pour le spectacle, une trame sonore vous accompagne. Les danseurs vous invitent alors à les suivre dans un parcours dansé où vous pourrez explorer la ville sous un nouvel angle. Qui plus est, l'univers sonore est modulé en fonction de l'endroit où vous vous trouvez. Votre proximité aux danseurs modifiera aussi la trame sonore, grâce à la géolocalisation et des balises installées sur les interprètes.

Cet événement, dont le titre sera dévoilé sous peu, est le prochain projet d'envergure pour la compagnie. Un prototype de l'application pour téléphone a été développé et des tests technologiques sont en cours. 2 500$ des 5 000$ récoltés lors de la campagne seront affectés à ce projet.

La première se déroulera à Montréal (Québec, Canada) en 2017. Plus de détails seront dévoilés bientôt!

 

Votre contribution est importante

RBDG est en pleine expansion! La compagnie a besoin de vous afin de l'aider à franchir ce nouveau cap.

En plus des contreparties offertes, RBDG s'engage évidemment à tenir les donateurs au courant du développement des projets par courriel.

Si vous ne pouvez pas offrir de soutien financier, nous vous invitons à partager la présente campagne sur vos réseaux sociaux. Chaque action peut nous aider!

 

Reconnaissance par les pairs

À ce chapitre, Victor Quijada a obtenu le Princess Grace Foundation Award (PGFA) — Choreography Fellowship (ÉU), le Peter Darrell Choreography Award (Angleterre), le Bonnie Bird North American Award (Angleterre) et le Choreography Media Honors (ÉU). Il a aussi été invité à se joindre au nouveau corps enseignant de la USC Kaufman en Californie, aux côtés de William Forsythe (ÉU). Un second PGFA lui a été décerné en 2016, sous la forme d’une résidence de création au Baryshnikov Arts Center de New York.

 

Notes sur les contreparties :

* un reçu canadien aux fins de l'impôt vous sera remis.

** un horaire sera envoyé aux donateurs suite à la campagne.

*** les billets offerts et le cocktail seront pour des spectacles de la saison 2016-2017.

**** le donateur sera contacté afin de faire concorder ses disponibilités avec celles de la compagnie. La prestation privée se déroulera à Montréal (Québec, Canada) en 2017.

***** l'atelier d'une durée de 1 heure sera offert à Montréal (Québec, Canada) en 2017.

-------

Please read below to find out more about the campaign and our two creation projects. By helping us reach our goal, you’ll be contributing to the ongoing development of a unique dance genre!

Your support will make a big difference in bringing these creation projects into being. Even a small donation will be appreciated and acknowledged, so please don’t hesitate to offer an amount you feel comfortable with.

 

RUBBERBANDance Group: Who are we?

With RUBBERBANDance Group (RBDG), choreographer Victor Quijada reconciles the two poles of dance aesthetics that live within him: the bold spontaneity and fearlessness of the hip-hop culture of his youth and the refined grace and choreographic maturity that he developed as a professional performer of ballet and contemporary dance.

Founded in 2002 in Montreal (Quebec, Canada), the company has since created 14 dance productions that have travelled throughout the world. RBDG’s most recent creation, Vic's Mix, is currently touring Quebec, the United States, and Europe.

RBDG has also produced five films choreographed by Victor Quijada, who also directed / codirected three of them: Secret Service, Small Explosions That Are Yours to Keep, and Gravity of Center. Over the years, several of Victor’s short films have won awards at festivals in different parts of the world.

 

What your donations will be used for:

Two innovative creation projects are scheduled for RBDG’s 2016-2017 season. By participating in our fundraising campaign, you’ll be helping to launch the company into a new era of creation, and also to expand.

Presentation of the projects in development

1) Creation residency at the Baryshnikov Arts Center

This residency, made possible by the Work in Progress Residency Award of the Princess Grace Foundation USA, will allow choreographer Victor Quijada, visual artist Sylvain Baumann and music composer Jasper Gahunia to create a new work within an institution on the cutting edge of stage production. Each one of the collaborators is deeply involved in the creation, so that Victor Quijada’s movements are set in a world radically different from that of RBDG’s other presentations. Artist Sylvain Baumann has created an architectural structure in metal for the occasion. It will be modified and manipulated, taking several different shapes during the performance of the work. The company thus takes on the completely new challenge of engendering movements within an architectural space – a set that is both rigid and malleable.

Victor Quijada and his collaborators will benefit from a creation residency at the famous Baryshnikov Arts Center in New York in 2017. Of the $5 000 we hope to raise in the campaign, $2 500 will be used for this residency project.

 

2) On site performance with technological elements

Imagine yourself in the heart of a city, in a place that, at first sight, doesn’t seem to lend itself to a dance performance. But before your eyes, the RUBBERBAND dancers take over the space by their bodies and movements. Equipped with your smartphone and an application designed specifically for the performance, you’ll hear the soundtrack that accompanies the action. The dancers invite you to follow them on a choreographed path that allows you to explore the city from a new angle. In addition, the soundscape is modulated according to where you are and your proximity to the dancers thanks to GPS technology and beacons attached to the performers.

This event, the title of which will be announced shortly, is the company’s next major project. A prototype of the smartphone app is in development and the technology is currently being tested. Of the $5 000 we hope to raise during the campaign, $2 500 will be dedicated to this project.

The premiere will take place in Montreal (Quebec, Canada) in 2017. Further details will be revealed soon!

 

Your contribution matters

RBDG is expanding! The company needs your help to take the plunge into this new phase.

Besides the perks offered in return for donations, RBDG will naturally make sure that donors are kept up to date on how the projects are evolving.

If you are unable to donate, we invite you to share this information about our campaign on your social networks. Every small gesture can help!

 

Peer recognition

Victor Quijada is the recipient of the Princess Grace Foundation Award (PGFA) – Choreography Fellowship (USA); the Peter Darrell Choreography Award (UK); the Bonnie Bird North American Award (UK); and the Choreography Media Honors prize (USA). He was also invited to join the teaching staff at the new Glorya Kaufman School of Dance at the University of Southern California, with William Forsythe, among others. In 2016, Victor Quijada won a second PGFA in the form of a creation residency at the Baryshnikov Arts Center in New York City.

 

Footnotes to Perks

* A Canadian receipt will be issued.

** A schedule will be sent to donors at the end of the campaign.

*** The complementary tickets, as well as the cocktail, will be for RBDG performances during the 2016-2017 season.

**** The donor will be contacted to coordinate his or her availability with the company’s. The private performance will take place in Montreal (Quebec, Canada) in 2017.

***** The workshop (1 hour length) will be offered in Montreal (Quebec, Canada) in 2017.

story:
EXCAVATION in development on Governor's Island

This week, September 10-16, I have a residency on Governor's Island (NYC), where I am working together with Marisela Grajeda Gonzalez (dramaturg) and Keelie Sheridan (director) to develop my first full-length original theatre project!

This project began with my grandmother, her story-telling practices, and her reverence for her ancestors. It began also with my own grief, my desire to understand intergenerational trauma, and my grappling with my Appalachian identity/heritage and relationship to class mobility. It has become, in part, a story of reckoning with my settler-colonizer ancestors and the violence I've inherited from them. This is a play about telling stories. This is a play about love and longing. And this is a play about systematic white amnesia.  It is part prayer, part horror story.

The project incorporates layers of folk song, movement, puppetry, text, and audio recording -- and draws upon several source materials, including family oral history, An Indigenous People's History of the United States by Roxanne Dunbar-Ortiz, and a series of letters to my ancestors.

My Collaborators

Keelie Sheridan (Director) works as a theatre & film-maker, choreographer and educator in NYC. She holds a MFA in Acting from Brooklyn College and was a 2016 George J Mitchell Scholar, which enabled her to receive a MFA in Directing at Trinity College Dublin/ The Lir Academy. Keelie has worked extensively as a teaching artist in public schools in Brooklyn and the Bronx and is currently on faculty at City College of New York and Brooklyn College. Keelie has been the Producing Artistic Director of The Ume Group since August 2016. She was a member of the original cast of The Ume Group's Dream Dances (2015), led The Ceíli Ensemble (2015) and directed 'by wing, fin, hoof or foot' (2017), for which she received a 2018 New York Innovative Theatre Award Nomination for Outstanding Movement and Choreography. Keelie is currently in post-production for the short film planet b234. Keelie has co-produced several new works initiatives and festivals, including The Lab at Grace & St. Paul's, UNFIX NYC and the Schreiber Shorts.

Marisela Grajeda Gonzalez (Dramaturg) is an actor, stand-up comic, writer, and teaching artist. She just wrapped her first lead role in a feature film. She performs stand-up in bars, clubs, theaters and attics all over NYC. Her humor and satire writing have been published in The Belladonna, LittleOldLady Comedy, The Haven, and Robot Butt. As a teaching artist, Marisela has taught improv, yoga, and theater in NYC public schools. She is also a drama therapy trained teaching artist leading social-emotional skills workshops with students of all ages. Currently Marisela is working on adapting a book of investigative journalism into a piece of documentary theater. She is thrilled to be collaborating and creating with this team on Excavation!  

 

What We Need

  • $1000 - Stipends for my creative team for this initial phase of development
  • $150 - Residency Fee
  • $100 - Books and other research materials
  • $25 - Art supplies
  • $75 - Indiegogo fees

If we surpass our goal, additional funds will go towards a small stipend for me and/or renting rehearsal space for future development beyond the residency! Thank you!

The Impact

This residency allows me one week of rehearsal space for the initial phase of development! During this week, we'll craft the narrative spine of the piece, and use the material we develop to apply for more residencies, grants, and festivals. Next steps include expanding the creative team and adding a puppetry/movement/vocal ensemble!

Having access to rehearsal space is huge. But I also couldn't make this work without the support of my creative team! The residency does not offer funding for this support. So I am asking for your help! Keelie and Marisela are an absolute DREAM TEAM and have allocated many, many hours (and brain & heart space) to this project already. I am so excited to have them on board and want to be able to keep working with them.

Please help!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this page with anyone who might be interested and able to donate!

Thank you!!

$25 - Art supplies
$75 - Indiegogo fees

If we surpass our goal, additional funds will go towards a small stipend for me and/or renting rehearsal space for future development beyond the residency! Thank you!


The Impact
This residency allows me one week of rehearsal space for the initial phase of development! During this week, we'll craft the narrative spine of the piece, and use the material we develop to apply for more residencies, grants, and festivals. Next steps include expanding the creative team and adding a puppetry/movement/vocal ensemble!
Having access to rehearsal space is huge. But I also couldn't make this work without the support of my creative team! The residency does not offer funding for this support. So I am asking for your help! Keelie and Marisela are an absolute DREAM TEAM and have allocated many, many hours (and brain & heart space) to this project already. I am so excited to have them on board and want to be able to keep working with them.
Please help!


Other Ways You Can Help
Share this page with anyone who might be interested and able to donate!
Thank you!!

story:
Lindsey Taylor is a dancer, choreographer and visual artist living in Austin, TX. In 2016 she was awarded the title of Best Dancer in the Austin Chronicle Reader's Poll. She is the founder of Little Stolen Moments interpretive dance trio, who were named Best Dance Company in 2010. She has recently performed with Blue Lapis Light, Jennifer Sherburn Dance, and created original work for Ballet East. Current collaborations include Total Unicorn, Foot Patrol, Thor and Friends, and Die Kranken (Los Angeles). Lindsey has toured internationally in Mexico and France, and has presented work in festivals such as CIMM Fest (Chicago) and CODAME (San Francisco). She has also produced several dance films that have screened in festivals throughout the US.

This is a dance performance in two acts.

Act I: Search for Flame, is set in prehistoric badlands and is loosely based on the 1981 film, Quest for Fire. A cast of six to eight dancers, set to a backdrop of projected imagery, will enact the saga of warring tribes of early human species in their search for life-giving fire. The piece is set to Don Sebasky’s saxophone heavy rendition of Stravinsky’s Rite of Spring, lending an air of sloping brow sexiness to the mix. A female soloist demonstrates how to produce the coveted element, ushering the bewildered cast into a dreamstate of gentile society in which posture becomes rigid and gesture meaning-laden. As the sapiens snap out of the fantasy, they sense the absurdity and discover laughter for the first time. In an instant, an enemy tribe ambushes and destroys them, along with their flame, thus ensuring death for everyone.

Act II: Jupiter, takes place in the far future where other planets in our solar system are being terraformed as Earth takes her final breath. An all female colony engages in ecstatic celebration based around an unfamiliar extra terrestrial holiday. Isao Tomita’s 1976 electronic rendition of Holst’s Jupiter sets the tone. The joyous celebration is interrupted by a transmission (from Earth?). The rulers of the Cosmos are delivering a personal message of congratulations on their success as a colony, followed by a ceremonial dance of reverence. Suddenly, the transmission begins to cut out, and it becomes clear that the beloved leaders have perished in an alien attack. The Jupiter colony is left to fend for itself, and having lost its lifeline, succumbs to suffering and death.

This piece is my most ambitious to date, involving many moving parts. Choreography, animation, costumes, props all coalesce to elevate the experience of live performance. Of course this costs money. Your contribution goes to the rental of rehearsal space, raw materials for props and costumes, and most importantly, compensation for the performers.

Please note the "Perks"!! For a starting donation of $25, you will receive a beautiful art print, two designs to choose from, drawn by me! For a donation of $150 or more, I will create an original illustration, inspired by Search for Flame/Jupiter.

story:
Black Women & Mental Health: Raising Awareness

I wrote this vignette series to  break silences and suffering and to show that there are lessons in recovery, resilience and healing in black women's stories. 

'Good mental health means having a positive sense of identity and sense of control over who you are. Mental distress can occur when a person feels overwhelmed by their emotions, life situations and pressures from the society we live in. Recovery is a process which involves making sense of one’s distress experiences and finding ways to cope with or overcome them. For recovery to be meaningful and lasting, it should focus on the person’s emotional world and their goals and expectations.' (Survivor Research - Mental Health Foundation)

 

I would be blessed for any financial support to enable me to pay for making this  project possible.  Your vital donations  will go to fund the  actors, director and creative team in  honour of their talent and the time they are giving. I especially would like to also   value their talent and dedication to  helping bring this project to fruition so as this important message can be raised.

There are voices still to be heard and stories  needing to be told. Together we are stronger. Supporting Mental Health and Black women within Theatre.

The performance will be on Saturday 30th June @4pm in the Gielgud Theatre, RADA. Tickets £5/£10

 

“Someday, somebody’ll
Stand up and talk about me,
And write about me – 
Black and beautiful – 
And sing about me,
And put on plays about me!
 

“Note on Commercial Theatre” Selected Poems of Langston Hughes

 

With thanks to the following artists and professionals who have worked tirelessly, volunteering their time, skills and creativity unpaid.

Don Kinch (associate producer)

Phillip Harper (musician/percussionist)

Joel Trill (voice coach)

Dora Jejey (actress)

Oluebube Ubadike (actress)

 

 

As well as family and friends, I  would like to also  acknowledge the following; Sandra Archer (artist),  Monae Robinson,  Judith Jacobs (actress/radio dj presenter for Conscious Radio),  Ayanna Serwaa (playwright), Femi Coker (actress), Suzann McLean (actor, writer, director, teacher), Simeilia Hodge-Dallaway (Artistic Directors of the Future),  Dr Lynette Goddard (Senior Lecturer in the Department of Drama and Theatre, Royal Holloway, University of London), Jo Wiltshire (RADA Festival Producer),  Dawn  (psychotherapist) and the sistas in the black women therapy group (Islington). 

*Any enquiries can be emailed to: contact@preciousandpreserved.co.uk

story:
We all want to have the best things in life. Here’s how you can help amazing dancers and choreographers become household names.

Join us. Cloud Dance Festival is a showcase of what’s hot and new in the contemporary dance and ballet world. It is a place for dancers and choreographers to present their best work to the people in the industry that will make their careers.

What Does Cloud Dance Festival Do For Dancers?

As you can imagine, dancing is not a stable job. People dedicate their lives to it out of love and passion for the artform. Cloud Dance Festival (CDF) offers a place to perform, develop innovative new work and test artistic boundaries. CDF is a place for dancers and choreographers to achieve the ‘One To Watch’ status from critics, be seen by the UK’s artistic directors and anyone who's hiring as well as create an audience following. CDF offers professional development packages and networking and we’ve been doing this since 2007.

Should Dancers wait tables or change someone’s life? It’s up to you.

The Arts Council believes in us and has given us some seed funding to invest in to become bigger and better – but we still need your help. We need to show partners (such as venues, funding bodies and sponsors) that the world wants amazing live performance that will change their lives.

This is where you come in.

We’re asking you to show your support loud and clear. We want you to share our success as we become bolder and brighter. When a dancer becomes a household name – you will have helped made that happen.

To thank you for being there for us, we’re inviting you to become an insider in the upcoming festival, Showtime (15-17 Nov 2013).  Even if you can’t be there in person, you can still win by being among the first to receive limited edition merchandise, films and photos of the dance and be an important voice in the future of the festival.

The Future of Performing Arts Belongs To People Who Care

The majority of grant-makers are chopping funding and all the arts are having to make a very clear cut and hard case that they deserve support of any kind. It’ll be up to you to vote your support for the arts – and it starts here.

Please join us. We look forward to meeting you.

Who Are We?

I’m Camilla Halford – as you’ll have seen in the video! I get passionate about creating opportunities for artists that will change your life. I’ve been doing this for 5 years and (although I tried to sell out once) I’ll be doing this for life; I love it too much.

Chantal Guevara is the powerhouse behind the festival. She’s the founding member from 2007 and it all started because she could see that dancers just weren't getting the opportunities they needed to be seen, have a place to present work and have the safety of developing as artists. She saw a lot of UK talent disappearing into oblivion, or seeking recognition elsewhere in Europe – and she’s dedicated to ensuring Britain gets the recognition it deserves for producing mind-blowing dancers.


Join our team. Make this happen.


Line-up for Showtime, November 2013 and website: www.cloud-dance-festival.org.uk



Video kindly produced by Yiannis Pelekanos

Cover image by James Rowbotham

Festival Director: Chantal Guevara

Development Manager: Camilla Halford
